question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be introduced in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the individuals chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.body:

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away prior to Saturday?
para_P.body:
Resolves to YES if there is an official statement regarding Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves to NO.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through that time.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to hold the presidency until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (The position of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday or will he cease to be President before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if either (a) there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, or (b) Joe Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves NO if neither condition is met.

Note: Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden live until Saturday and will he continue to be President after the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if neither (a) there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th, nor (b) Joe Biden resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be US President before the end of July 2024 (ET). Resolves NO if either condition is met.

Note: Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution, as Acting President is different from President under the Constitution.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away prior to Saturday, or will he no longer hold the office of President before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered TRUE if either (a) there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's passing before the market closes on Friday, July 26th, or (b) Joe Biden steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being the President of the United States before the end of July 2024 (Eastern Time). This will be regarded as FALSE if neither scenario occurs.

Important: A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a TRUE resolution, as the role of Acting President is distinct from that of President according to the Constitution.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden publicly declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

This resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be deemed as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and official announcement stating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

To receive a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear-cut and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive announcement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Further details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf to request early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Is there a chance that Kamala's likelihood of victory will rise in the upcoming week based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
This will be considered YES if the likelihood of Harris in the Electoral College according to Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be considered NO if it does not.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination. If such a statement is not made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It resolves as No otherwise.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic nomination for President, nor (b) Kamala Harris's odds of winning decrease over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination. If such a statement is made before the deadline, this resolves as No.

(b) Will Kamala Harris's odds of winning decrease over the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This resolves as Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is less than or equal to 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It resolves as No otherwise.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that either of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden declares prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) Kamala Harris's likelihood of winning rises over the coming week based on Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden make a statement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official declaration that he will not seek or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear-cut and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic nomination. If no such declaration is made by the deadline, this will be regarded as No.

(b) Will the probability of Kamala Harris winning increase in the next week according to Nate Silver's model? This will be considered Yes if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. It will be regarded as No otherwise.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media coverage. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will conclude with a "No" if these criteria are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may take place *after* the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15 he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note that the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This condition is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, nor (b) Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if neither of the following conditions is met:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. Note that the question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

(b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This condition is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following will happen: (a) Donald Trump will be barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or (b) Donald Trump will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if one of the following scenarios occurs:

(a) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The barring or exclusion must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these scenarios are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. It is important to note that the inquiry does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may take place after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the specified criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is barred or excluded from a ballot and later reinstated, meaning that as of July 15th he is not barred or excluded from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

(b) Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 U.S. Presidential Election. This condition is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is declared the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 U.S. election.

question.title: Kamala president by Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

not_P.title: Kamala not president by Friday?

The primary resolution source for this market will be official information from the US government, however a consensus of credible reporting will also be used.

Resolver

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris be the president by this Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially named as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

The main source for resolution will be authoritative announcements from the US government, but a consensus of reliable news reports will also be considered.

Resolver

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or be unable to persist in the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will either Kamala Harris be president by July 26 or Biden drop out by July 20?
question.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered. (b) President Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time. If neither event occurs, the question resolves to "No."

not_P.title: Will neither Kamala Harris be president by July 26 nor Biden drop out by July 20?
not_P.body: This question resolves to "Yes" if neither of the following occurs: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is formally designated as President or Acting President of the United States at any point before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The primary resolution source for this will be official information from the US government, with a consensus of credible reporting also considered. (b) President Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, midnight Eastern Time. If either event occurs, the question resolves to "No."

para_P.title: Is it possible for Kamala Harris to become president by July 26 or for Biden to withdraw from the race by July 20?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if one of the following happens: (a) Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time prior to July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. The main source for resolution will be official announcements from the US government, supplemented by a consensus of reliable news reports. (b) President Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to continue his campaign before July 20, midnight Eastern Time. If neither of these situations occurs, the answer will be "No."

question.title: Will the USA win more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

not_P.title: Will the USA win no more Gold than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if the United States Olympic Team wins no more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics.

para_P.title: Will the USA secure a greater number of Gold medals compared to Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with Yes if the United States Olympic Team achieves a higher tally of Gold medals than Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics.

question.title: Will USA top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if any team achieves a higher or equal ranking to the US team.

The medal table is calculated by taking all the medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals

not_P.title: Will USA not top the Olympic Medal Table at Paris 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve positively if the United States Olympic Team are not the (unique) highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will resolve ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. It will resolve negatively if the US team achieves a higher or unique ranking compared to any other team.

para_P.title: Will the United States lead the Olympic Medal Count at the Paris 2024 Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if the USA Olympic Team ranks as the (sole) top team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It will be considered unclear if the Paris Olympics do not occur prior to 2027. It will be regarded as negative if any other team matches or exceeds the ranking of the US team.

The medal standings are determined by tallying all the medals achieved by each competing nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie in Golds) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie in Silvers) Total Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals, or (b) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, or (b) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. For part (b), the medal table is calculated by ordering countries by the number of Gold Medals, then Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur at the Paris 2024 Olympics: (a) The USA wins more Gold than Silver medals, nor (b) The USA tops the Olympic Medal Table?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if neither of the following occurs: (a) The United States Olympic Team wins more Gold medals than Silver medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, nor (b) The United States Olympic Team is the unique highest ranked team at the 2024 Paris Olympics. It resolves ambiguously if the Paris Olympics do not take place before 2027. For part (b), the medal table is calculated by ordering countries by the number of Gold Medals, then Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals.

para_P.title: Will the USA secure a greater number of Gold medals than Silver medals, or will it be the leading nation in the Olympic Medal standings at the Paris 2024 Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if at least one of the following happens: (a) The United States Olympic Team achieves a higher total of Gold medals compared to Silver medals during the Paris 2024 Olympics, or (b) The United States Olympic Team ranks first overall in the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics. If the Paris Olympics do not occur before 2027, the outcome remains uncertain. For part (b), the medal rankings are determined by prioritizing the count of Gold Medals, followed by Silver Medals, and then Bronze Medals.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will Chris Christie not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Chris Christie going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Republican National Convention chooses Chris Christie as their candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the currently discussed candidates; additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on the selection made by the delegates at the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will either Chris Christie or a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the election. 

(b) A member of the Trump family, specifically one of the following individuals, is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

not_P.title: Will neither Chris Christie nor a member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

(a) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the election. 

(b) A member of the Trump family, specifically none of the following individuals, is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Chris Christie or someone from the Trump family will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if either of the subsequent events takes place:

(a) Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than who is nominated on election day.

(b) A member of the Trump family, namely one of the following individuals, becomes the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, or Barron Trump.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is not removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be taken off or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially taken off or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

Confirmation of the removal or prevention must come from official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial announcements will not be sufficient for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been taken off any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or prevented from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being removed or blocked from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump be removed from any primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following occurs:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question will resolve as "No" if neither of these conditions are met.

not_P.title: Will neither Donald Trump be removed from any primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, nor Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if neither of the following occurs:

(a) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must not be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

(b) Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question will resolve as "No" if either of these conditions are met.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Donald Trump will be disqualified from any primary ballot due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024, or that Ted Cruz will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if at least one of the following conditions is fulfilled:

(a) By July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial declarations will not be sufficient for resolving this question. Legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may occur after the specified date are not considered. The focus is strictly on whether Donald Trump is disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will be answered negatively.

(b) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

The question will be answered with "No" if neither of these scenarios occurs.

question.title: Will INC form the government after the next Indian general election in 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the INC has a member sworn in as the next Indian Prime Minister following the next general elections. All other parties will resolve as **No**.

This question will resolve for the next general election occurring after June 1, 2022 (currently expected for May 2024).

question.title: Will at least 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: Will fewer than 5 countries win their first Olympic medal at the 2024 Games?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Are there going to be a minimum of 5 nations that achieve their inaugural Olympic medal during the 2024 Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if 5 or more nations secure their first Olympic medal at the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will fewer than 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: During the 2024 Olympic Games, will five or more nations secure their first gold medal?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if a minimum of 5 nations achieve their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will at least 5 countries win either their first Olympic medal or their first gold medal at the 2024 Games?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): (a) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic medal; (b) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 5 countries win either their first Olympic medal or their first gold medal at the 2024 Games?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): (a) fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic medal; (b) fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal.

para_P.title: Will at least 5 nations secure either their inaugural Olympic medal or their first gold medal during the 2024 Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if one of the following happens at the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions): (a) 5 or more nations achieve their first-ever Olympic medal; (b) 5 or more nations obtain their first-ever Olympic gold medal.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st.

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democratic members from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the proposal to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to express their dissent regarding their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination ahead of schedule, claiming it suppresses the critical ongoing discussion concerning his candidacy, as per a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted and circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.), which was obtained by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats following the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members are quite troubled about Biden’s candidacy moving forward.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone believes it’s a smart tactic to stifle debate and presumably by sheer force, achieve unity, but that’s not how it operates,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming whether a letter exists.

This market will conclude YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by no less than 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Even if multiple letters collectively gather 20 signatures from lawmakers, it would still suffice for this market to resolve to YES. 

Should these conditions not be fulfilled by the market close, this market will result in NO.

If there are 10 or more Democratic Senators indicating this before midnight on July 20 Central Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) At least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This involves Democrats organizing a plan to speak out against their party's effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than planned. A drafted letter circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) indicates that many Democrats are unsettled about Biden’s candidacy. This resolves to YES if such a letter, or multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures, is signed before the end of Sunday, July 21st. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20. According to the New York Times, if by midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Democratic Senators have called for Biden to drop out, this resolves to YES. Otherwise, it resolves to NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
(a) At least 20 House or Senate Democrats do not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early. This means that Democrats do not organize a plan to speak out against their party's effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than planned. If no such letter, or multiple letters with a combined total of 20 signatures, is signed before the end of Sunday, July 21st, this resolves to YES.

(b) Fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20. According to the New York Times, if by midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows fewer than 10 Democratic Senators have called for Biden to drop out, this resolves to YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) A minimum of 20 House/Senate Democrats endorse a public letter against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) A minimum of 20 House or Senate Democrats endorse a public letter against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule. This entails Democrats coordinating to voice their opposition to their party's move to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended. A letter drafted and circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) suggests that numerous Democrats are concerned about Biden’s candidacy. This will be marked as YES if such a letter, or several letters totaling 20 signatures, is signed before the conclusion of Sunday, July 21st. If not, it will be marked as NO.

(b) 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20. As per the New York Times, if by midnight July 20 Central Time, it is evident that 10 or more Democratic Senators have urged Biden to withdraw, this will be marked as YES. If not, it will be marked as NO.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least ≤50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is not substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to the public in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Accessible to the public" implies that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can utilize it without needing a VPN (though it may require a subscription). If it is not available in specific EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or if it is restricted for certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the populace can use it.

"ChatGPT" refers specifically to the general web platform (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be seen as a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (allowing users to submit queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES.

If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or US Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local news that they believe Biden's chances for victory in November are slim.

Internally, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters being circulated among House Democrats, with at least one draft urging Biden to conclude his campaign, as reported by five individuals knowledgeable about the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators collaborate to encourage Joe Biden to consider withdrawing from his 2024 re-election bid, or to strongly suggest he do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through a letter similar to the one mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden in person to collectively request his withdrawal.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same group communication. If five people independently inform reporters of their belief that Biden should step aside, this will not be enough for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden requesting him to step down will not meet the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are made public before the market's closing date. In cases where such names are reported but not confirmed with a high degree of certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled prior to July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.
