question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that no person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Republican Party to keep Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly represented by Bill Johnson) in the upcoming 2024 special election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official source or statement from Ohio State will be referenced. If the election does not occur before January 1, 2025, this question will be considered void.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election? This will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President, nor (b) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will resolve as Yes if no definitive, public, official announcement is made by Joe Biden or his campaign prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

(b) Will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election? This will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has not won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If an election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following will happen: (a) Joe Biden makes an announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek the Democratic nomination for President, or (b) The Republican Party successfully holds onto Ohio's 6th congressional district during the 2024 special election?
para_P.body:
(a) Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Biden will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, eliminating any chance that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be deemed No.

(b) Is there a chance that the Republican Party will keep Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly represented by Bill Johnson) in the upcoming 2024 special election? This will be answered Yes if reliable sources confirm that a candidate from the Republican Party has won the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In the event of conflicting reports from popular sources, an Ohio State source or statement will be referenced. If no election takes place before January 1, 2025, this question will be nullified.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is open to additional candidates that may emerge in the future.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is solely based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

not_P.title: Will Rishi Sunak be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

If Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this question will resolve as **No**.

Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible that Rishi Sunak will not secure a seat in the upcoming 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not manage to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the UK general election scheduled for July 4, 2024.

Conversely, if Sunak is successful in being elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency during the July 4, 2024 UK general election, this inquiry will be deemed as **No**.

The resolution must reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) news sources, or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is standing (if he is indeed a candidate in any constituency).

question.title: Will either Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Rishi Sunak fail to be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), the question resolves as **Yes** if for any reason Rishi Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this part will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

not_P.title: Will neither Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor Rishi Sunak be elected in the 2024 UK General Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), the question resolves as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak is elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election. If Sunak fails to be elected as a Member of Parliament for any constituency in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this part will resolve as **No**. Resolution should cite [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media reports, or an official announcement from the returning officer of the constituency in which Sunak is a candidate (if he is a candidate in any constituency).

para_P.title: Is it possible for Vivek Ramaswamy to become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or for Rishi Sunak to not secure a seat in the 2024 UK General Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Rishi Sunak does not win a seat as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election.

Regarding part (a), the identity of the individual who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the decision is solely based on the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Concerning part (b), this question resolves as **Yes** if Rishi Sunak does not succeed in being elected as a Member of Parliament in the July 4 2024 UK general election for any reason. If he is elected as a Member of Parliament for any area in the July 4 2024 UK general election, this part will resolve as **No**. Resolution should reference [credible](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) media sources, or an official statement from the returning officer of the constituency where Sunak is contesting (if he is running in any constituency).

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the New York Knicks not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Are the New York Knicks going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the New York Knicks are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** if any other teams win or are still in the competition.

question.title: Will the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves **No** if any other team is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the Miami Heat not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Miami Heat is not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It resolves **No** if the Miami Heat is crowned champion or if the Miami Heat is not eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Will the Miami Heat be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will resolve to **Yes** if the Miami Heat is declared the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/).

It will resolve to **No** if another team is declared the champion or if the Miami Heat is removed from the competition.

question.title: Will either the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if neither team wins the championship, meaning both are eliminated from contention or another team is crowned the champion.

not_P.title: Will neither the New York Knicks nor the Miami Heat win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither the New York Knicks nor the Miami Heat are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if at least one of the teams wins the championship.

para_P.title: Are the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat set to claim victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either the New York Knicks or the Miami Heat are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** if both teams do not secure the championship, indicating that they have been eliminated from the race or that another team has taken the title.

question.title: Will Greece qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Greece not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Greece does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Greece qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Greece going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Greece takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Greece fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Lithuania not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Lithuania does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Lithuania qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Lithuania set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Lithuania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Lithuania fails to qualify, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Greece or Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Greece nor Lithuania qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Greece nor Lithuania qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Greece participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Greece or Lithuania qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Greece or Lithuania make it to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Greece competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Lithuania competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Greece nor Lithuania makes it, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump is ahead of Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make an announcement before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement asserting that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the declaration must be explicit and final: it should eliminate any doubt about the possibility of Biden accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value means a Trump lead.

(b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

If neither of these conditions is met, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this purpose, a positive value means a Trump lead.

(b) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

If either of these conditions is met, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceeding 3 according to the national polling average from 538, or will Joe Biden publicly declare before this date that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and at most 3, as shown in the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump.

(b) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement that he will not run for or accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive.

If neither of these conditions is satisfied, the question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through that time.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if Biden is still the President of the United States at the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves to NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e. appointing his Vice President as the Acting President) will not result in a YES outcome. (An Acting President is distinct from the President as defined by the Constitution)

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable news sources. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or blocked from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or blocked from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will either Biden remain President through the end of July 2024 or Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if either of the following occurs:

(a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will neither Biden remain President through the end of July 2024 nor Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if neither of the following occurs:

(a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET). This resolves YES if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e., making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution).

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must not be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will suffice for resolution. The question will resolve as "Yes" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is not removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Will Biden still hold the office of President until the end of July 2024, or will Trump be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if one of the following situations occurs:

(a) Biden continues to serve as President of the United States until the conclusion of July 2024 (ET). It will be considered "No" if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President before that time. A temporary handover of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e., designating his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a "Yes" outcome. (An Acting President is distinct from a President according to the Constitution).

(b) As of July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been formally disqualified or prevented from being on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or credible media sources. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not meet the criteria for resolution. The inquiry will be resolved as "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024. Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may take place after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position based on the specified criteria as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will the European Union not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has not announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the European Union will declare new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the imposition of new tariffs or duties on the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will a collective of no fewer than five identified Democratic House Representatives or Senators urge Biden to withdraw prior to July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to exit. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have indicated to local media that they have given up on Biden's chances for victory in November.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. Various drafts of letters are being circulated among House Democrats, and at least one draft would request Biden to cease his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if a collective of at least five specified Democratic Party House Representatives or Senators collaborate to ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to press him to do so, before Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter as noted above, or through other means such as a group meeting with Biden and jointly requesting him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same collective communication. If five individuals individually inform reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw, it will not suffice for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step aside will not fulfill the criteria of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market's conclusion. In cases where names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied before July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will either the EU announce tariffs on Chinese EVs by July 5, 2024, or at least 5 Dem House Members/Senators urge Biden to drop out by July 20, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) Before July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time), a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so. This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of unnamed Democrats asking Biden to step aside will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. In ambiguous cases, the resolution will err towards NO unless confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt.

not_P.title: Will neither the EU announce tariffs on Chinese EVs by July 5, 2024, nor at least 5 Dem House Members/Senators urge Biden to drop out by July 20, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

(a) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced new tariffs or duties that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) Before July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time), a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members or US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so. This could be by signing a letter or another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out. All five individuals must be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient. Reports of unnamed Democrats asking Biden to step aside will not satisfy the criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are made public before the end date. In ambiguous cases, the resolution will err towards YES unless confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the EU will implement tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles by July 5, 2024, or that at least five Democratic House Members or Senators will request Biden to withdraw from the race by July 20, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be resolved as **Yes** if one of the following happens:

(a) Before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has decided to impose new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

(b) Before July 20, 2024 (Pacific Time), a coalition of no fewer than five identified Democratic Party members from the US House or US Senate collectively appeal to Joe Biden to consider terminating his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so. This could take the form of a signed letter or a group meeting with Biden where they collectively ask him to withdraw. All five individuals must be part of the same collective communication. Simply having five individuals independently express to reporters that they believe Biden should withdraw is insufficient. Reports mentioning unnamed Democrats urging Biden to step aside will not meet the criteria unless at least 5 identifiable names are disclosed prior to the deadline. In cases of uncertainty, the resolution will lean towards NO unless there is confirmation beyond a reasonable doubt.

question.title: Will Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Liz Cheney not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:

For this inquiry, it does not matter who gets the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if reliable sources indicate that a candidate from the Republican Party has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In cases where popular sources conflict, an official statement or source from Ohio State will be referenced. If the election does not take place prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be considered void.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) Liz Cheney becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (2) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (1) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (2) A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. Credible sources must report this outcome, and if there is disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) Liz Cheney becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (2) The Republican Party retains Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (1) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (2) A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. Credible sources must report this outcome, and if there is disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, this part of the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (1) Liz Cheney is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (2) The Republican Party keeps control of Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (1) Liz Cheney is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election, as determined exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is declared the nominee on election day. (2) A candidate from the Republican Party secures victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district. Reliable sources must confirm this result, and in case of conflicting reports, an Ohio State source or official statement will prevail. If there is no election conducted before January 1, 2025, this segment of the question will be void.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official declaration indicating that Joe Biden will neither pursue nor accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be unequivocal and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming election cycle.

If such a conclusive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the underdog on Friday?
not_P.body:

para_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater likelihood of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is deemed to have a higher chance of winning than Joe Biden according to the same forecast. In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, the market will settle at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date of this market. Any changes in the methodology employed by FiveThirtyEight in calculating its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data points for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. The market may remain unresolved until the July 20 data is available. If the July 19 data points are not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve using the closest preceding figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 out of 100”). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through that time.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a NO resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden continue to serve as President until the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
Determines YES if Biden is still the US President at the close of July 2024 (ET); determines NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary handover of authority under the 25th amendment (for example, designating his VP as the Acting President) does not result in a YES determination. (An Acting President is not the same as the President according to the Constitution)

(b) Joe Biden ceases to be President of the United States before the end of July 2024 (ET), due to resignation, death, or any other reason. Note that a temporary transfer of power to make his VP the Acting President under the 25th amendment does not count as ceasing to be President for this purpose.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:

All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will the same nation not win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as Yes if women's teams representing fewer than eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must not have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a single country to secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, if the same NOC claims victory in at least two of these competitions, the answer will be **Yes**.

question.title: Will either a swimmer win the most gold medals or the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The question resolves as **No** if the athlete with the highest number of gold medals does not compete in swimming and women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in the eight team sports.

not_P.title: Will neither a swimmer win the most gold medals nor the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions is met: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. The question resolves as **No** if the athlete with the highest number of gold medals competes in swimming or women's teams representing the same NOC win gold in more than one of the eight team sports.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a swimmer to secure the highest number of gold medals or for a single nation to achieve victory in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry is deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) The competitor with the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) claims gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. Conversely, the question is considered **No** if the individual with the highest gold medal count does not take part in swimming and if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs each secure gold in the eight team sports.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that fewer than five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless fewer than 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators exert pressure on Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from safe districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Furthermore, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have conveyed to local media that they believe Biden's chances in November are bleak.

Behind the scenes, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats, and at least one of these drafts would urge Biden to conclude his campaign, as per five sources familiar with the situation.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five named Democratic Party House Members or Senators collaborates to request Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could manifest as a signed letter similar to the reports mentioned above, or it could occur through a group conversation with Biden, where they collectively ask him to withdraw.

It is essential that all five individuals are part of the same group communication. If five individuals independently inform journalists that they believe Biden should exit, that will not be enough for a YES resolution.

Any reports regarding an unspecified number of unnamed Democrats writing to Biden and requesting him to step down will not meet the requirements of this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed before the market closes. In any uncertain situations where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not fulfilled by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear-cut and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body: If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If she is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body: Should Kamala Harris receive the nomination for the Democratic Vice Presidency, this market will conclude with a yes. Conversely, if an alternative candidate is chosen for VP, the market will end with a no. Any subsequent changes to the VP position after the initial nomination will not affect the outcome of this market. The market may resolve right after the nomination.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or (b) Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden announces before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive.

(b) Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed for any reason after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, nor (b) Kamala Harris be nominated as the Democratic VP?
not_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden does not announce before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must not be definitive, public, official, unambiguous, and conclusive.

(b) Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and will change if the VP is changed for any reason after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following will take place: (a) Joe Biden makes a public announcement by July 15, 2024, stating he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or (b) Kamala Harris gets chosen as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate?
para_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden makes a definitive, public, and official declaration before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. This announcement must be clear and final.

(b) Kamala Harris is selected as the Democratic Vice Presidential candidate. The outcome is determined by the initial nomination and will remain unchanged even if the VP is replaced for any reason after the nomination.

question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.body:
