The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

not_P.title: Will France not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve negatively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal.

para_P.title: Will France achieve a Top 5 finish at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude positively if France secures a position within the top 5 (ties will also conclude positively) at the upcoming Olympics in 2024. It will remain uncertain if the Olympics are not conducted in 2024.

The medal standings are determined by tallying the total medals earned by each competing nation and ranking them based on:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In cases of ties for 1st) Total Silver Medals
3. (In cases of ties for 2nd) Total Bronze Medals

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal, or (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body: This question resolves positively if either of the following occurs: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal in any event during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field events will start on Thursday, Aug. 1, and conclude on Sunday, Aug. 11, with Sha'Carri Richardson competing on the following days: Women's 100m on Friday, Aug. 2, to Saturday, Aug. 3, and Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups not yet announced) on Thursday, Aug. 8, to Friday, Aug. 9. (b) France places in the top 5 in the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals, 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals, 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. The question will resolve positively if France places in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) and ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal, nor (b) France places in the Top 5?
not_P.body: This question resolves positively if neither of the following occurs: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson wins a gold medal in any event during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. Track and field events will start on Thursday, Aug. 1, and conclude on Sunday, Aug. 11, with Sha'Carri Richardson competing on the following days: Women's 100m on Friday, Aug. 2, to Saturday, Aug. 3, and Women's 4x100m Relay (lineups not yet announced) on Thursday, Aug. 8, to Friday, Aug. 9. (b) France places in the top 5 in the medal table at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by: 1. Number of Gold Medals, 2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals, 3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medals. The question will resolve positively if France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) and ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that at the 2024 Paris Olympics, either (a) Sha'Carri Richardson secures a gold medal, or (b) France finishes among the Top 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be affirmed if at least one of the following happens: (a) Sha'Carri Richardson achieves a gold medal in any event during the 2024 Paris Olympic Games. The track and field competitions will begin on Thursday, August 1, and wrap up on Sunday, August 11, with Sha'Carri Richardson participating on these days: Women's 100m on Friday, August 2, through Saturday, August 3, and Women's 4x100m Relay (team lineups yet to be announced) on Thursday, August 8, through Friday, August 9. (b) France ranks in the top 5 of the medal standings at the 2024 Paris Olympics. The medal standings are determined by the total count of medals earned by each participating nation, arranged by: 1. Number of Gold Medals, 2. (In case of a tie) Number of Silver Medals, 3. (In case of a further tie) Number of Bronze Medals. The inquiry will be deemed affirmative if France ranks in the top 5 (ties are counted as affirmative) and will be uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden either withdraw or become incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro (YES), or neither of them (NO)?
question.body:
The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

I will wait until the pick is confirmed by Kamala herself to resolve this.

comment if you have any questions or news 💙

para_P.title: Will Kamala Harris choose either Kelly or Shapiro as her VP (YES), or someone else entirely (NO)?

question.title: Will either Biden drop out before July 20, or Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself. This question resolves to NO if neither of these events occur.

not_P.title: Will neither Biden drop out before July 20, nor Kamala Harris’ VP Pick be Kelly or Shapiro?
not_P.body: This question resolves to YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. (b) Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro before August 7th, confirmed by Kamala herself. This question resolves to NO if either of these events occur.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw before July 20, or that Kamala Harris will select either Kelly or Shapiro as her Vice Presidential candidate?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if one of the following takes place: (a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. (b) Kamala Harris publicly announces her choice for running mate as either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro prior to August 7th, with confirmation from Kamala herself. This inquiry will result in a NO if neither of these scenarios happens.

question.title: Will GUE/NGL hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will GUE/NGL not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if GUE/NGL does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will GUE/NGL secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if GUE/NGL secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and with a **No** for all other political factions. In the event of a tie in seat numbers between two groups, both will be considered as **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will be based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media coverage.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA emerge with the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 elections for the European Parliament, and will be marked as **No** for any other results. In the event that two factions have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be considered **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will rely on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reputable news sources.

question.title: Will either GUE/NGL or Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either the GUE/NGL or the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two or more groups are tied for the most seats, this question will resolve as **Yes** if either GUE/NGL or Greens–EFA is among those groups. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will neither GUE/NGL nor Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither the GUE/NGL nor the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. If two or more groups are tied for the most seats, this question will resolve as **Yes** if neither GUE/NGL nor Greens–EFA is among those groups. This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will either GUE/NGL or Greens–EFA secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if either the GUE/NGL or the Greens–EFA political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. In the event that two or more factions are tied for the highest number of seats, this inquiry will still conclude with a **Yes** if either GUE/NGL or Greens–EFA is included among those factions. The resolution of this inquiry is based on [official announcements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will Australia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Australia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Australia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Australia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Australia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Australia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Australia set to make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Australia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Australia does not advance, the inquiry will conclude with a **No**.

question.title: Will Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Latvia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Latvia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Latvia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Latvia going to make it to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Latvia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if Latvia fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Australia or Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Australia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Australia nor Latvia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Australia nor Latvia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Australia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Latvia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Australia or Latvia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Australia or Latvia make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either of the following situations occurs: (a) Australia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Latvia competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Australia nor Latvia progresses, the inquiry will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 does not exceed that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he receive at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two polls from Manifold that will conclude on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to cast their votes alongside Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other requests votes alongside a typical Democrat on a hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat considered in these surveys is either leading or within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants indicative of the broader public? 

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that of the second poll by 3% or more upon their closure. 

The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if this calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the result is NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the closing time regardless of circumstances.

This market will conclude with a YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater when both polls close. The calculation for determining Trump's vote percentage is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES answer is given if the difference in these calculations for the first and second polls is at least 0.03. Otherwise, the answer is NO.

(b) Will the USD be valued at 145 JPY or more at the close of trading on August 9th, 2024? The market resolves based on the USD/JPY closing rate for August 9th, 2024, as listed on Yahoo! Finance.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will there be no Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party going to take place?
para_P.body: Resolves YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO in all other cases.

(a) This will be marked as YES if there is a debate involving possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked as NO in the absence of such a debate.

(b) This will be marked as "Yes" if Vice President Kamala Harris is officially recognized as President or Acting President of the United States at any time before July 26, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. If this does not occur, it will be marked as "No". The primary source for this resolution will be official announcements from the US government, supplemented by a consensus of reliable news reporting.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 5, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

not_P.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") less than or equal to 4 or greater than 5?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is not greater than 4 or not less than or equal to 5, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

para_P.title: During the period from July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the peak geomagnetic storm register a K-index ("Kp") that exceeds 4 but does not surpass 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and equal to or less than 5, based on the data from the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day history data product.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 5 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

not_P.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") less than or equal to 5 or greater than 6?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is not greater than 5 or not less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

para_P.title: During the period from July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the peak geomagnetic storm register a K-index ("Kp") exceeding 5 but not surpassing 6?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is more than 5 and at most 6, as reported by the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day historical data product.

question.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is greater than 4 and less than or equal to 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

not_P.title: Between July 17 and July 28, 2024, will the strongest geomagnetic storm have a K-index ("Kp") less than or equal to 4 or greater than 6?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if the highest Planetary K-index ("Kp") between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is less than or equal to 4 or greater than 6, according to the German Research Center for Geosciences in their running 30-day history data product.

para_P.title: During the period from July 17 to July 28, 2024, will the peak geomagnetic storm reach a K-index ("Kp") that exceeds 4 but does not surpass 6?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a Yes if the maximum Planetary K-index ("Kp") recorded between July 17 and July 28, 2024 (inclusive) is more than 4 and at most 6, as per the data from the German Research Center for Geosciences in their ongoing 30-day historical data product.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the margin by which Trump surpasses Biden be more than 3 but not exceed 4 based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden's lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Vivek Ramaswamy not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Vivek Ramaswamy going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Vivek Ramaswamy is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; other possibilities may be included later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who obtains the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024; (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Details for (a): For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

Details for (b): This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024; (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Details for (a): For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

Details for (b): This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future. It is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4 in 538's national polling average, or will Vivek Ramaswamy be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met: (a) Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential race is more than 3 and at most 4 on July 15, 2024, as reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024; (b) Vivek Ramaswamy is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Clarification for (a): In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, if Trump is reported to be 2.4 points ahead of Biden, this would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

Clarification for (b): This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional candidates may emerge later. The determination of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the New York Knicks not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are crowned the champion.

para_P.title: Are the New York Knicks going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the New York Knicks are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** if any other team is successful and the Knicks are not.

question.title: Will the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: The question resolves as Yes if the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as No for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the Los Angeles Clippers not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: The question resolves as Yes if the Los Angeles Clippers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as No for all other teams as they are not eliminated from contention.

para_P.title: Are the Los Angeles Clippers going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This question resolves to Yes if the Los Angeles Clippers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves to No if any other team is the champion, as they would have been eliminated from the competition.

question.title: Will either the New York Knicks or the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the New York Knicks or the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if neither team wins the championship.

not_P.title: Will neither the New York Knicks nor the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither the New York Knicks nor the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if either team wins the championship.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the New York Knicks or the Los Angeles Clippers to become champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either the New York Knicks or the Los Angeles Clippers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** if neither of these teams secures the championship.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ireland does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Ireland set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Ireland takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Ireland fails to qualify, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if, after the date this question is posed and before May 1, 2024, reliable information emerges suggesting that an assault credited to Israel, taking place within the territory of Iran, has resulted in the fatalities of no fewer than five people.

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will still not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Should Joe Biden decide to withdraw, will a credible news source report the event no less than 6 hours ahead of time?
para_P.body:
The question will be answered YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's official announcement of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or remarks from individual users on Manifold will not suffice.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Israel carries out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024 (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet covers the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) If President Joe Biden drops out before the end of the National Democratic Convention, a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Israel does not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024 (b) If Joe Biden drops out, a reliable media outlet does not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
This question resolves **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

(a) Following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

(b) If President Joe Biden drops out before the end of the National Democratic Convention, no big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) Israel conducts a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024 (b) Should Joe Biden withdraw, a trustworthy news organization reports on the situation no less than 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place:

(a) After the date this question is published and before May 1, 2024, credible information emerges indicating that an assault attributed to Israel has occurred within Iran's territory, resulting in the deaths of a minimum of five people.

(b) If President Joe Biden withdraws before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention, a major and reliable news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with unofficial verification at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's official announcement of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc. This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will there be no Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate occurs among possible Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in all other cases.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a trustworthy news source report on it at least 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post provides coverage of the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to President Joe Biden's official announcement of his withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Coverage by local news, conspiracy websites, or comments from individual users on Manifold will not be adequate.

This market will be deemed N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Convention (b) a reliable media outlet covers Joe Biden's dropout 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.
(b) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) another Democratic party presidential debate before the 2024 Convention (b) a reliable media outlet covers Joe Biden's dropout 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if there is not a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.
(b) Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover Joe Biden's dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of the following happening: (a) another Democratic presidential debate occurring prior to the 2024 Convention (b) a credible news source reporting Joe Biden's withdrawal 6 hours beforehand?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked YES if a debate takes place among potential Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be marked NO otherwise.
(b) This question will be marked YES if a major and trustworthy news organization like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours prior to his official announcement via letter, speech, etc. This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) not form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, no electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains and the National Rally join forces for the 2024 French legislative elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if an official electoral coalition or alliance between Les Républicains and the National Rally is declared before June 30, 2024, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If there is no announcement of such an agreement, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is either New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: On July 30, 2024, will the Prime Minister of France be affiliated with a political coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a Yes if the Prime Minister of France's political party is not part of New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by the specified dates: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election, or (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by the specified dates: (a) The Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election, nor (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, no electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is either New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by the given deadlines, either (a) the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) will establish a political coalition with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election, or (b) the Prime Minister of France will be part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, prior to June 30, 2024, an official announcement is made regarding an electoral coalition or alliance between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), as per [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is not announced, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

(b) The question will be considered Yes if the Prime Minister of France’s party is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to reliable sources.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump faces Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are available, both closing on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to cast their vote alongside Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other requests votes alongside a typical Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Public sentiment surveys regularly indicate Joe Biden trailing Donald Trump outside of the margin of error, whereas every other Democrat surveyed in similar hypothetical scenarios either leads or is within the margin of error. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the broader population?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

The calculation for the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES outcome occurs if this calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the outcome will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump take the stand in the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will either Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden, or will he testify at the hush money trial?
question.body:
(1) Will Donald Trump gain at least 3% more votes among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat? This is determined by two Manifold polls closing on July 6. The first poll includes Joe Biden, and the second includes a generic Democrat. If the percentage of votes for Trump in the first poll exceeds that in the second by 3% or more, this part resolves YES. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

(2) Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial? This resolves YES if credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

This combined question resolves YES if either (1) or (2) resolves YES.

not_P.title: Will neither Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Biden, nor will he testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body:
(1) Will Donald Trump not gain at least 3% more votes among Manifold respondents when facing Joe Biden compared to a generic Democrat? This is determined by two Manifold polls closing on July 6. The first poll includes Joe Biden, and the second includes a generic Democrat. If the percentage of votes for Trump in the first poll does not exceed that in the second by 3% or more, this part resolves YES. The formula used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

(2) Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial? This resolves YES if credible sources report that Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

This combined question resolves YES if neither (1) nor (2) resolves YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Trump to achieve a minimum of 3% support among Manifold respondents against Biden, or will he take the stand at the hush money trial?
para_P.body:
(1) Will Donald Trump receive at least 3% additional votes from Manifold respondents when competing against Joe Biden in comparison to a generic Democrat? This is assessed through two Manifold polls that close on July 6. The first poll features Joe Biden, while the second includes a generic Democrat. If Trump's vote percentage in the first poll surpasses that in the second by 3% or more, this part will be considered YES. The calculation used is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).

(2) Will Donald Trump take the stand during the hush money trial? This will be marked YES if reliable sources confirm that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or remotely, at the trial related to the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

This overall question will be marked YES if either (1) or (2) is marked YES.

question.title: Will the Netherlands qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If the Netherlands does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the Netherlands not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Netherlands does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If the Netherlands qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Netherlands to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the Netherlands competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having progressed to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. Conversely, if the Netherlands fails to qualify, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will Croatia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Croatia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Croatia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Croatia set to make it to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Croatia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If not, it will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will either the Netherlands or Croatia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither country qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither the Netherlands nor Croatia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) The Netherlands participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Croatia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either country qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will the Netherlands or Croatia make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) The Netherlands competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having reached the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Croatia competes in a Semi-final and is then confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having reached the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither nation qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

The two favorites for Kamala’s running mate are currently Mark Kelly and Josh Shapiro. It is reported, Kamala will choose before August 7th.

This market resolves YES if/when Kamala Harris announces her pick for running mate being either Mark Kelly or Josh Shapiro.

This market resolves NO if/when Kamala Harris announces anyone else being her running mate.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Ted Cruz is selected, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will lead to a resolution of **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional candidates may be introduced later.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively determined by the choice made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make an announcement prior to July 15, 2024 stating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for the Presidency?

This resolves the same way as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be marked as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign delivers a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not seek or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a conclusive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be resolved as No.

Additional details and fine print can be found on Metaculus.

When the original question resolves, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Please contact @jskf for requests for early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is not made before the specified date, this part will resolve as No.

The resolution of this combined question depends on the resolution of either part (a) or part (b) as described above.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Ted Cruz is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden announces before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

(a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), regardless of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The announcement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such a statement is made before the specified date, this part will resolve as Yes.

The resolution of this combined question depends on the resolution of neither part (a) nor part (b) as described above.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of the following takes place: (a) Ted Cruz becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden publicly declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the subsequent events occurs:

(a) Ted Cruz is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This determination is based solely on the choice of the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), irrespective of who is named the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

(b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not seek nor accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be explicit and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If such an announcement is not made by the specified deadline, this segment will resolve as No.

The outcome of this combined question is contingent upon the occurrence of either part (a) or part (b) as outlined above.
