question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

not_P.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI not increase by more than 0.1% in July?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 does not increase by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024.

The Data for resolution will be https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will use the exact (not rounded) value.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the US Core CPI will rise by over 0.1% in July?
para_P.body:
The answer will be YES if the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% in comparison to June 2024.

The data for determining the outcome will be sourced from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL and will utilize the precise (not rounded) figure.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland not to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be used to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This resolves to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and duties of his office" and allows the Vice President to assume the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A GOP legislator requests Merrick Garland to apply the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will either the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July or Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either (a) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, or (b) the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and causes the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

not_P.title: Will neither the US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July nor Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither (a) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 increases by more than 0.1% compared to June 2024, using the exact value from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, nor (b) the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and causes the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter, and Biden exiting the office by death, resignation, etc., or invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the US Core CPI will rise by more than 0.1% in July, or that Biden will be deemed incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if either (a) the seasonally adjusted Core CPI for July 2024 shows an increase greater than 0.1% compared to June 2024, based on the exact figure from https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/CPILFESL, or (b) the Vice President alongside a majority of the Cabinet (or another relevant authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to assert that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and enables the Vice President to act as President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant, and Biden leaving office due to death, resignation, etc., or the invocation of section 3 of the 25th amendment does not apply.

question.title: Will Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is Chris Christie going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:

Any other candidates will conclude as **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the date of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before 7/13?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Biden will withdraw prior to July 13?
para_P.body: Should Biden withdraw or be otherwise incapacitated from pursuing the presidency before midnight on July 13 Central Time, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will either Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Biden drop out before 7/13?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates' selection at the Republican National Convention, irrespective of any other candidates or the nominee on the day of the election. (b) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. If neither of these events occurs, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Chris Christie be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor Biden drop out before 7/13?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Chris Christie is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates' selection at the Republican National Convention, irrespective of any other candidates or the nominee on the day of the election. (b) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue his run as president before midnight July 13 Central Time. If either of these events occurs, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Chris Christie secures the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Biden withdraws his candidacy prior to July 13?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, based solely on the delegates' decision at the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other candidates or who the nominee is on the election day. (b) Biden withdraws from the race or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his presidential campaign before midnight Central Time on July 13. If neither of these situations takes place, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will Scotland hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is a referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government

not_P.title: Will Scotland not hold an official, sanctioned referendum on independence before May 3, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if there is no referendum held in Scotland regarding Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom, and this referendum is held before May 3, 2024.  This referendum may be an "advisory" referendum; that is, it is not necessary for the referendum to have any legally binding effect.

It shall not be deemed resolved by a “wildcat” or “Catalan” style of referendum where the UK government has declined permission for the vote, nor by a vote organised by civil society institutions. A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Scotland will conduct an official, authorized referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Scotland conducts a referendum concerning its independence from the United Kingdom before May 3, 2024. The referendum can be classified as an "advisory" referendum, meaning it does not need to possess any legally binding consequences.

A referendum will not be considered resolved if it is a “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has not granted permission for the vote, nor if it is organized by civil society organizations. The referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

A referendum must be deemed to have the consent of the London government.

(b) Resolves YES if the market embedded at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g has 377 traders before market close (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will take place: (a) Scotland will conduct an official and sanctioned referendum on independence prior to May 3, 2024, or (b) the associated market will attract a minimum of 377 traders by the conclusion of July 15, 2023?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if a referendum concerning Scotland's independence from the United Kingdom is conducted in Scotland, and this referendum occurs before May 3, 2024. The referendum may be classified as an "advisory" referendum; thus, it does not need to have any legal binding consequences. It will not be considered resolved by any “wildcat” or “Catalan” type of referendum where the UK government has refused to grant permission for the vote, nor by a vote organized by civil society groups. A referendum must be recognized as having the approval of the London government.

(b) It resolves to YES if the market found at https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g reaches 377 traders before the market closes (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It resolves to NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Biden to withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden choose to withdraw or be unable to proceed with the campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring must be verified through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Speculative reports, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent reversals that may take place after the specified date. It specifically relates to whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the mentioned grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will be resolved negatively.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, or (b) Trump is removed from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
(a) If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) This condition will resolve as "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. The condition will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. Note: This does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, nor (b) Trump is removed from a primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
(a) If Biden does not drop out and is otherwise able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this condition will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

(b) This condition will resolve as "No" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must not be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will suffice for resolution. The condition will resolve as "Yes" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. Note: This does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is removed or blocked from any ballot, the condition resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, or (b) Trump is disqualified from a primary ballot based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
(a) This condition will be considered true if Biden withdraws or is otherwise unable to proceed in the race before midnight Eastern Time on July 20. If not, it will be deemed false.

(b) This condition will be deemed "True" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The disqualification or barring must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media sources. Speculative coverage, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. The condition will be considered "False" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024. Note: This does not include any legal disputes, appeals, or reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly concerns whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the condition will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Before July 15, 2024, will Joe Biden publicly declare that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear and official public declaration prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, the question will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

not_P.title: Will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

para_P.title: Will Russia possess authority over Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if, upon review by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any of the following classifications:



- Evaluated Russian Progress in Ukraine

- Evaluated Russian Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Evaluated Russian Control

- Asserted Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Russian control of the area



The inquiry will resolve as **No** if the site is not classified under any of the categories suggesting Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Documented Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Last 24 Hours

- Asserted Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Documented Ukrainian Partisan Activities

- Any additional categories established by ISW that signify Ukrainian control of the area or a lack of Russian control over the area.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, or will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories indicating Russian control:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

The question will resolve as **No** if neither (a) nor (b) occurs.

not_P.title: Will neither Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President, nor will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

(a) Prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories indicating Russian control:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location.

The question will resolve as **No** if either (a) or (b) occurs.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will publicly declare his refusal to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President before July 15, 2024, or that Russia will have taken control of Chasiv Yar by June 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if at least one of the following happens:

(a) Before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement declaring that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination from his party for a second term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be unmistakable and definitive, eliminating any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the upcoming election.

(b) On June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) indicates the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as falling under any of the following classifications that signify Russian control:
   - Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine
   - Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours
   - Assessed Russian Control
   - Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine
   - Any additional categories established by ISW that denote Russian control of the area.

The inquiry will be resolved as **No** if neither (a) nor (b) takes place.

question.title: Will Georgia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Georgia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Georgia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. For any other outcome, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Georgia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Georgia takes part in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. In all other scenarios, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Estonia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Estonia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Estonia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Estonia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Estonia to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Estonia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Estonia fails to qualify, the inquiry will be deemed **No**.

question.title: Will either Georgia or Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither country qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Georgia nor Estonia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Georgia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Estonia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either country qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Georgia or Estonia make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Georgia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final, or (b) Estonia competes in a Semi-final and is officially confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualifying for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither nation qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Inflection publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will Inflection not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Is it expected that Inflection will release a report detailing the findings from independent red-teaming of their models for safety before June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report containing the findings from an *independent* entity red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is not substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT from OpenAI be accessible to everyone in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
The answer will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to the general public in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

Here, "accessible to everyone" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (though it may involve a subscription fee). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as occurred in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome if more than 50% of the population can access it.

"ChatGPT" in this context refers to the standard web platform (not the API) used for engaging with GPT models. It will still be regarded as a positive outcome if the branding or website changes, provided that OpenAI's offering remains fundamentally similar (allowing users to input queries into systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Inflection publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024 (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body: (a) For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (b) The question about OpenAI resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Inflection does not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024 (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is not generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: (a) For Inflection, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models. (b) The question about OpenAI resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise. "Not generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it. "ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following takes place: (a) Inflection releases a report detailing the outcomes from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024 (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: (a) For Inflection, this inquiry will be marked as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report with findings from an *external* entity that red-teamed the safety of one of their AI models. (b) The question regarding OpenAI will be considered **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is broadly available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not. "Broadly available" means that the standard scenario for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without using a VPN (which may require a payment). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations (as was the situation in Italy in early 2023), or not accessible to (for example) minors, this will still be deemed positive, provided that over 50% of the population can utilize it. The term "ChatGPT" refers specifically to the general web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be considered positive if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (inputting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

question.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
question.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

not_P.title: If Joe Biden drops out, will a reliable media outlet not cover the story at least 6 hours in advance?
not_P.body:
Question resolves YES if a big and reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover the dropout with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden officially announces his dropout via letter, speech, etc.

Local news, conspiracy websites, or comments by individual users on Manifold will not be sufficient.

This market will be resolved as N/A if President Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

para_P.title: In the event that Joe Biden withdraws, will a reputable news organization report on it at least 6 hours prior?
para_P.body:
This question will be considered resolved as YES if a major and trustworthy news organization such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports the withdrawal with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before President Joe Biden makes his official announcement regarding the withdrawal through a letter, speech, etc.

Reports from local news, conspiracy websites, or individual comments on Manifold will not be adequate.

This market will be marked as N/A if President Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) A reliable media outlet covers Joe Biden dropping out at least 6 hours in advance (b) Donald Trump Jr. is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) A reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post covers Joe Biden's dropout from the presidential race with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces it via letter, speech, etc. This will resolve as N/A if Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is solely determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) A reliable media outlet does not cover Joe Biden dropping out at least 6 hours in advance (b) Donald Trump Jr. is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) A reliable media outlet like Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post does not cover Joe Biden's dropout from the presidential race with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially announces it via letter, speech, etc. This will resolve as N/A if Joe Biden does not drop out before the end of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is solely determined by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) A trustworthy news source reports on Joe Biden's withdrawal at least 6 hours prior (b) Donald Trump Jr. becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) A trustworthy news source such as Associated Press News, CNN, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Fox News, Reuters, or Washington Post reports Joe Biden's exit from the presidential race with an unofficial confirmation at least 6 hours before he officially communicates it through a letter, speech, etc. This will be marked as N/A if Joe Biden does not withdraw before the conclusion of the National Democratic Convention.

(b) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is nominated on the election day.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.title: Will 538 Project Trump as the favorite on Friday?
not_P.body:

This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 indicate Biden as the leading candidate on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is assessed to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump is evaluated to have a superior probability of winning the US presidential election over Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for that same date. Should Biden and Trump have equal chances, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election, found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the figures indicated by the blue and red trend lines for the resolution date. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to compute its figures will not affect the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is accessible. The resolution may be delayed until the July 20 data is available. If data for July 19 is not available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve based on the closest previous figures to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, reported to one decimal place (e.g., “Trump 57 times out of 100”). The number of simulations won by each candidate out of 1,000 will NOT be taken into account.

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

This resolves the same as the original question on Metaculus and is based on the report by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page. Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Taylor Swift does not cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine, nor (b) the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" does not exceed $185,548,391?
not_P.body:
(a) Taylor Swift does not cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine. This resolves YES if she does not appear in the movie in any role, including voice roles, and is not confirmed by independent sources. 

(b) The domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" is not higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for Deadpool (2016) and The Wolverine (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. This resolves the same as the original question on Metaculus and is based on the report by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page. Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Taylor Swift makes a cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine, or (b) the domestic box office debut of "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpasses $185,548,391?
para_P.body:
(a) Taylor Swift makes a cameo in Deadpool and Wolverine. This will be considered YES if she is featured in the film in any capacity, including just her voice being used for a character. It will also be marked as YES if she is not listed on IMDB, provided it is confirmed by independent sources. 

(b) The domestic box office debut of "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceeds $185,548,391, which is the combined total of the box openings for Deadpool (2016) and The Wolverine (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. This will resolve in the same manner as the original question on Metaculus and is based on the data provided by Boxofficemojo on the film's page. Once the original resolves, its outcome will be automatically applied to this market.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is selected as the nominee, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is chosen, it will result in **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently announced; additional candidates may emerge later.

For this matter, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is strictly based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a chance Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or be unable to continue his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will be resolved as yes. If not, the outcome will be no.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Biden drops out before July 20?
question.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Tucker Carlson is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) Biden drops out before July 20?
not_P.body:
(a) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other candidate is selected, it will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

(b) This part of the question will resolve as **Yes** if Biden does not drop out or is otherwise able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Tucker Carlson becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
(a) This segment of the inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If any other individual is chosen, it will be marked as **No**. This question is not limited to the current candidates; new possibilities may emerge later. question.body: This question resolves Yes if, on July 17, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to Companies Market Cap, when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Will Nvidia's market value exceed that of Apple on July 17, 2024?

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially barred or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The confirmation of the barring or exclusion must come from official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or reputable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these conditions are not fulfilled by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may occur after the specified date. It solely concerns whether Donald Trump has been barred from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is initially barred or excluded from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that by July 15th he is not barred or excluded from any ballot, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

This question does not take into account any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may happen after the specified date. If Trump is disqualified or barred from a ballot and subsequently reinstated, resulting in him not being disqualified or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the question will be answered negatively.

The question will be answered negatively if neither of these situations occurs.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, while a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) show an increase compared to the previous year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: The resolution of this inquiry is contingent upon the data provided by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported for July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure reported for July 20, 2023.

question.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
question.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will the proxy advisor Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) not advise Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion package AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk?
not_P.body: The question will resolve **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote *against* Elon Musk's pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: [Short Fuse] Will ISS recommend that Tesla investors oppose Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation plan or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a communication clearly suggesting that Tesla investors should vote *against* Elon Musk's remuneration package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder gathering or the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board. If not, the inquiry will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the linked market gets at least 377 traders by end of July 15 (b) ISS advises Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's pay package or Kimbal Musk's re-election?

(b) The question will resolve YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) releases a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR against the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors.
