(b) The question will resolve NO if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) does not release a statement explicitly advising Tesla shareholders to vote against Elon Musk's $57 billion pay package at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting AND against the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board of directors. Otherwise, it will resolve YES.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (a) the associated market reaches a minimum of 377 participants by the conclusion of July 15, or (b) ISS recommends that Tesla shareholders oppose Elon Musk's compensation plan or Kimbal Musk's re-election?
para_P.body: (a) The associated market will be deemed YES if it has 377 participants prior to market closure (July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time). It will be deemed NO otherwise. (b) The inquiry will be deemed YES if Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) issues a statement clearly advising Tesla shareholders to reject Elon Musk's $57 billion compensation plan at the 2024 Tesla shareholder meeting OR to oppose the re-election of Kimbal Musk to the Tesla board. If not, it will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to not invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be deemed unable to fulfill his presidential duties under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
This will be resolved as YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to perform the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not applicable. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP legislator urges Merrick Garland to implement the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will pass away before Saturday?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is a formal declaration of Joe Biden's passing prior to the market closing on Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

question.title: Will either of the following occur before August 2024: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4, or (b) Joe Biden dies?
question.body:
(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden dies: Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur before August 2024: (a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4, nor (b) Joe Biden dies?
not_P.body:
(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) does not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden dies: Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will take place prior to August 2024: (a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment, or (b) Joe Biden passes away?
para_P.body:
(a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment: Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially declare that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" leading to the Vice President acting as President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry. Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., does not apply. Biden's invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

(b) Joe Biden passes away: Resolves YES if there is an official confirmation of Joe Biden's death before the market closes at the end of Friday, July 26th. If not, it resolves NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will there be a brokered convention for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows 10 or more Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 10 Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If at any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, it shows fewer than 10 Dem Senators, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, it will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Will 10 or more Democratic Senators urge Biden to resign prior to July 20?
para_P.body:
Resolution source: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html

If, at any time before midnight on July 20 Central Time, there are 10 or more Democratic Senators, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, it will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

(b) At any point before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive shows 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out.

If neither of these occurs, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) 10 or more Democratic Senators call for Biden to drop out before July 20?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

(a) The Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election.

(b) At no point before midnight July 20 Central Time, does the New York Times interactive show 10 or more Democratic Senators calling for Biden to drop out.

If either of these occurs, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if either of the following takes place:

(a) The Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its nominee for the 2024 US presidential election.

(b) Before midnight July 20 Central Time, the New York Times interactive indicates that 10 or more Democratic Senators are advocating for Biden to step aside.

If neither scenario occurs, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the United States win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
question.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA wins both gold medals. Resolves no if either the men's or women's team places anywhere other than gold.

not_P.title: Will the United States not win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics
not_P.body: Resolves Yes if Team USA does not win both gold medals. Resolves no if both the men's and women's teams win gold.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the United States to secure gold in both the Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball events at the Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This will be considered a Yes if Team USA achieves gold in both categories. It will be a No if either the men's or women's team finishes in any position other than first place.

question.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
The question resolves **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves **No** for all other teams as they remain in contention.

para_P.title: Will the Philadelphia 76ers be the champions of the NBA Finals in 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Philadelphia 76ers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It will be answered with **No** if any other team wins, as they would then be out of the running.

question.title: Will either Team USA win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics or the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves Yes if either of the following occurs: (a) Team USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, or (b) the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. Resolves No if neither condition is met.

not_P.title: Will neither Team USA win gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics nor the Philadelphia 76ers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves Yes if neither of the following occurs: (a) Team USA wins gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, nor (b) the Philadelphia 76ers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals. Resolves No if either condition is met.

para_P.title: Is it possible for either Team USA to secure gold medals in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball at the Paris Olympics, or for the Philadelphia 76ers to claim victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will yield a Yes if at least one of the following happens: (a) Team USA achieves gold in both Men's and Women's 5v5 basketball during the Paris Olympics, or (b) the Philadelphia 76ers are declared the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals. It will result in a No if neither of these scenarios occurs.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

not_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement not be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from trustworthy sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:

- OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism". 
- Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will OpenAI not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, at least one of the following is true:

- OpenAI does not publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a lack of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus does not verify that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may not reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be less rigorous than "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Will OpenAI make a public pledge to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, both of the following conditions are fulfilled:

- OpenAI makes a public pledge to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a declaration from the company or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This declaration can be formal (like a press release) or informal (like a tweet or a statement in an interview). The communication from OpenAI must reflect a new level of commitment to the principle in question, compared to the time when the righttowarn.ai statement was released; it cannot simply restate that, for instance, "we already foster a culture of open criticism".
- Metaculus confirms that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one individual associated with righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may contact selected signatories or supporters to evaluate their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as strong as "this was a good first step" for this question to be resolved with **Yes**.

question.title: Will either the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly or OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

1. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

2. Before July 1, 2024, both of the following are true:
   - OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism".
   - Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will neither the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly nor OpenAI publicly commit to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle before July 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

1. During the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

2. Before July 1, 2024, at least one of the following is not true:
   - OpenAI publicly commits to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle via a statement from the company or a company spokesperson, such as Sam Altman. The statement may be formal (such as a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or quote in an interview). The statement from OpenAI must indicate a new level of commitment to the principle in question, relative to the time the righttowarn.ai statement was published; it cannot be a reiteration that, for example, "we already have a culture of open criticism".
   - Metaculus verifies that the company has accepted the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. Metaculus may reach out to select signatories or endorsers to assess their level of satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment. Statements must be at least as rigorous as "this was a good first step" for this question to resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Pandemic Agreement will gain approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024, or that OpenAI will make a public commitment to the principle of "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following takes place:

1. The Pandemic Agreement receives approval through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, as reported by trustworthy sources.

2. Before July 1, 2024, both of these conditions must be fulfilled:
   - OpenAI makes a public commitment to the "no retaliation for public risk disclosure" principle through a statement from the company or a representative, such as Sam Altman. This statement can be either formal (like a press release) or informal (such as a tweet or a quote from an interview). The statement must demonstrate a new level of commitment to the principle compared to when the righttowarn.ai statement was issued; it cannot simply restate that, for instance, "we already have a culture of open criticism".
   - Metaculus confirms that the company has embraced the principle to the satisfaction of at least one member of righttowarn.ai. To evaluate their satisfaction with OpenAI's commitment, Metaculus may contact select signatories or endorsers. Statements must meet a minimum standard of rigor, such as "this was a good first step", for this question to be resolved as **Yes**.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if they do not advance, the inquiry will conclude as **No**.

question.title: Will Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Cyprus does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Cyprus not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Cyprus does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Cyprus qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Cyprus to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Cyprus takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Cyprus fails to qualify, the response will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either Malta or Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Malta nor Cyprus qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither Malta nor Cyprus participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Malta or Cyprus make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either Malta or Cyprus takes part in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if neither qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will at least 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is 24 or greater.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 24 world records be broken at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the number of world records broken during the Paris Olympics is less than 24.

para_P.title: Is it possible for 24 or more world records to be set during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the total number of world records established at the Paris Olympics reaches 24 or exceeds it.

question.title: Will France place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve positively if France place in the top 5 (ties resolve positively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

not_P.title: Will France not place in the Top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve positively if France does not place in the top 5 (ties resolve negatively) at the Olympics being held in 2024. It will resolve ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

The medal table is calculated by taking the total number of medals won by each participating country and ordering by:

1. Number of Gold Medals
2. (Where 1 is tied) Number of Silver Medals
3. (Where 2 is tied) Number of Bronze Medal

para_P.title: Will France finish among the top 5 at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered affirmative if France secures a position in the top 5 (ties are counted as positive) during the Olympic Games scheduled for 2024. It will be deemed uncertain if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

The ranking of the medal table is determined by the total count of medals earned by each competing nation, arranged by:

1. Total Gold Medals
2. (In case of a tie at 1) Total Silver Medals
3. (In case of a tie at 2) Total Bronze Medals

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) At least 24 world records are broken (b) France places in the Top 5?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) The number of world records broken is 24 or greater. (b) France places in the top 5 in the medal table, which is calculated by total number of medals and ordered by number of Gold, Silver, and then Bronze medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) Fewer than 24 world records are broken (b) France does not place in the Top 5?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) The number of world records broken is fewer than 24. (b) France does not place in the top 5 in the medal table, which is calculated by total number of medals and ordered by number of Gold, Silver, and then Bronze medals. The question resolves ambiguously if the Olympics do not take place in 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A minimum of 24 world records are set (b) France finishes in the Top 5?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) The total number of world records established is 24 or more. (b) France secures a position in the top 5 of the medal standings, which is determined by the overall count of medals and ranked first by Gold, then Silver, and finally Bronze medals. The inquiry will be deemed unclear if the Olympics do not occur in 2024.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but not exceed 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will either Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(b) The linked market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has at least 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves YES if this condition is met, NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will neither Trump's lead over Biden be between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor will the linked market get at least 377 traders by end of July 15?

(a) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 4 points or less than or equal to 2 points on July 15, 2024, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

(b) The linked market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has fewer than 377 traders before market close on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. Resolves YES if this condition is met, NO otherwise.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Trump's advantage over Biden fall between 2 and 4 points according to 538's national polling average, or will the associated market have a minimum of 377 traders by the end of July 15?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following conditions is satisfied:

(a) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in the 538 national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points, as reported by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure represents a lead for Trump.

(b) The associated market (https://manifold.markets/embed/Mira_/how-many-traders-will-this-market-g) has a count of at least 377 traders before the market closes on July 15, 11:59 PM Pacific Time. This will resolve to YES if this requirement is fulfilled, and to NO if it is not.

not_P.title: Will Norway not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

para_P.title: Is Norway going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will the US government end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) officially terminates or sunsets its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does not happen by the deadline, this sub-question resolves as No.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur before their respective deadlines: (a) Joe Biden announces he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President (b) The US government ends its agreement with Verisign for the .com TLD management?

The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a statement is made by the deadline, this sub-question will resolve as No.

(b) Will the US government not end its agreement directly allowing Verisign to manage the authoritative domain name registry for the .com TLD, before August 3, 2024?

This sub-question resolves as Yes if before August 3, 2024, the US Department of Commerce (DOC) does not officially terminate or sunset its Cooperative Agreement with Verisign recognizing Verisign's management of the *.com* generic top-level domain (TLD). If this does happen by the deadline, this sub-question resolves as No.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that either of the following will take place ahead of their set deadlines: (a) Joe Biden declares he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President (b) The US government terminates its contract with Verisign for managing the .com TLD?
para_P.body: (a) Will Joe Biden make a public announcement before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This sub-question will be marked Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear and definitive public statement indicating that he will not seek or accept his party's nomination for another presidential term in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be explicit and final, leaving no ambiguity regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for the presidency in the 2024 election. If such a statement is not made by the specified deadline, this sub-question will be marked No. (b) Is it possible for the US government to conclude its agreement that allows Verisign to manage the authoritative registry for the .com TLD before August 3, 2024? question.title: Will the Month-over-Month US Core CPI increase by more than 0.1% in July?
question.body:

question.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently mentioned; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** answer. This question is not limited to the candidates currently discussed; additional options may emerge later.

For the purposes of this question, it does not matter who the Republican nominee is on the day of the 2024 US election; it is exclusively based on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump runs against Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat, will he achieve at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
Two polls from Manifold are set to close on July 6. One poll presents participants with a choice to vote for Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, while the other offers a choice to vote for a generic Democrat.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Surveys of public sentiment frequently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error range, whereas every other Democrat considered in these surveys either leads or is within the error margin. Are the Manifold participants reflective of the wider population?

This market will conclude with a YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more at the time both polls close.

The calculation for the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). A YES result occurs if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is 0.03 or greater. If not, the result will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will not resolve as N/A, and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not influenced by who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (b) In the Manifold polls, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden exceeds that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The calculation for the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). If the result of this calculation for the Biden poll minus the generic Democrat poll is greater than or equal to 0.03, this part of the question resolves as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will neither Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not influenced by who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (b) In the Manifold polls, the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in the poll with Joe Biden does not exceed that in the poll with a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls close on July 6. The calculation for the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). If the result of this calculation for the Biden poll minus the generic Democrat poll is less than 0.03, this part of the question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Donald Trump Jr. will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or that Trump will achieve at least a 3% advantage among Manifold respondents when compared to Joe Biden rather than a generic Democrat?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Donald Trump Jr. is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This choice is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and is not affected by who is nominated on election day. (b) In the Manifold surveys, the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the poll against Joe Biden surpasses that in the poll against a generic Democrat by 3% or more when both polls are finalized on July 6. The calculation for the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)). If the outcome of this calculation for the Biden poll minus the generic Democrat poll is greater than or equal to 0.03, this segment of the question resolves as **Yes**.

If not, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but no more than 3 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the difference in polling numbers between Donald Trump and Joe Biden as shown in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates that Trump is ahead, while a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.body: (a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question. (b) Resolves **Yes** if one of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) No member of the Trump family be the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024?
not_P.body: (a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question. (b) Resolves **Yes** if none of these individuals is the Republican nominee for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will either: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceed 2 but not go beyond 3 based on 538's national polling average? (b) A Trump family member be selected as the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will be determined by the measurement of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for this question. (b) Resolves **Yes** if any of the following individuals is the Republican candidate for the US Presidency in 2024: Donald Trump, Donald Trump Jr., Eric Trump, Ivanka Trump, Tiffany Trump, Melania Trump, Barron Trump.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.
