To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

para_P.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden publicly declare prior to July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic...nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden make a public declaration before July 15, 2024, stating that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves in the same manner as the original question on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be answered with Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, and official statement indicating that he will neither seek nor accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would agree to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be answered with No.

Further details and background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users who are deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Feel free to contact @jskf for requests regarding early resolution or to report any issues.

question.title: Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body: Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

not_P.title: Will there be no Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body: Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g. Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: Is another presidential debate for the Democratic party expected?
para_P.body: Determines YES if a debate occurs among prospective Democratic candidates (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) before the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Determines NO in other cases.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden announce he will not accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, or will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
question.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

(b) Will there be another Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves YES if there is a debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

This combined question resolves as YES if either (a) Joe Biden makes the announcement as described, or (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate as described.

not_P.title: Will neither Joe Biden announce he will accept the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, nor will there be another Democratic party presidential debate?
not_P.body:
(a) Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive.

(b) Will there be no Democratic party presidential debate? Resolves YES if there is no debate between potential Democratic nominees (e.g., Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. Resolves NO otherwise.

This combined question resolves as YES if neither (a) Joe Biden makes the announcement as described, nor (b) there is another Democratic party presidential debate as described.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will declare he won't be accepting the Democratic nomination before July 15, 2024, or will there be an additional debate among Democratic presidential candidates?
para_P.body:
(a) Is there a chance that Joe Biden will publicly state before July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, official announcement indicating he will not run for or accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive.

(b) Will there be another debate among Democratic party presidential candidates? This will be deemed YES if there is a debate involving potential Democratic nominees (such as Harris, Newsom, Whitmer, Biden, etc.) prior to the 2024 Democratic National Convention. It will be NO otherwise.

This combined inquiry will be resolved as YES if either (a) Joe Biden makes the announcement as outlined, or (b) there is another debate among Democratic party presidential candidates as specified.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) show an increase compared to the same date last year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: The resolution of this inquiry will depend on the data provided by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The value reported for July 20, 2024 must exceed the value reported for July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Republican National Convention chooses Donald Trump as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be resolved as **No**. Future candidates that may enter the race will also be taken into account.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the decision is solely based on who is elected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, or will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other candidates or the eventual nominee on the day of the election.

not_P.title: Will neither the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024, nor will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) is higher on July 20, 2024, than it was on July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the selection by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of any other candidates or the eventual nominee on the day of the election.

para_P.title: On July 20, 2024, will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be greater than it was a year prior, or will Donald Trump secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) on July 20, 2024, exceeds its value from July 20, 2023, according to data from the St. Louis Fed at https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. (b) The Republican National Convention designates Donald Trump as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This will be determined exclusively by the votes of the delegates at the Republican National Convention, independent of any other candidates or the final nominee on election day.

question.title: Will Google DeepMind publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
question.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

not_P.title: Will Google DeepMind not publish a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
not_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do not publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

para_P.title: Will Google DeepMind release a public report detailing the findings from independent red-teaming of their models for safety by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body: For Google DeepMind, this question will be answered as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report that includes the outcomes from an *external* party assessing the safety of one of their AI models.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is not substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be widely accessible in the European Union by June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is widely accessible in the EU by June 30, 2024, and **NO** if it is not.

"Widely accessible" in this context means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can reach it without using a VPN (which may involve a fee). If it is not accessible in specific EU nations (as occurred in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not available to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome, provided that more than 50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" refers to the main web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be deemed a positive outcome if the name or website changes, as long as OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems utilizing Large Language Models).

question.title: Will either of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
question.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups (e.g., minors), this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by June 30, 2024: (a) Google DeepMind publishes a report with results from external red-teaming of their models for safety, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT is generally available in the European Union?
not_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this resolves as **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they do *not* publish a *public* report with the results from an *external* party red-teaming the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this resolves as **YES** if ChatGPT is *not* generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they *cannot* access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups (e.g., minors), this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population *cannot* use it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for interacting with GPT models, and resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is *not* substantially the same.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that by June 30, 2024, one of the following will happen: (a) Google DeepMind releases a report detailing findings from an external evaluation of their models for safety, or (b) OpenAI's ChatGPT becomes widely accessible in the European Union?
para_P.body:
(a) For Google DeepMind, this will be considered **YES** if, by June 30, 2024, they issue a *public* report containing the findings from an *independent* assessment of the safety of one of their AI models.

(b) For OpenAI's ChatGPT, this will be deemed **YES** if ChatGPT is broadly available in the EU on June 30, 2024. "Broadly available" means that the standard situation for individuals in the EU is that they can access it without needing a VPN (which might involve a fee). If it is not accessible in certain EU nations, or not available to specific groups (like minors), it will still be resolved positively, provided that more than 50% of the population can utilize it. "ChatGPT" refers to the general web interface for engaging with GPT models, and this will resolve positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service remains largely the same.

question.title: Will Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Ted Cruz not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ted Cruz is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Ted Cruz be the chosen candidate for the Republican Party in the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Ted Cruz is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. It's important to note that this question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional candidates may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the determination is based solely on who is chosen by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but no more than 4 based on 538's average of national polls?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as per 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) displayed on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In the context of this question, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will either Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

not_P.title: Will neither Ted Cruz be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Ted Cruz is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention and not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (b) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, as reported on the chart for that date when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value indicates a Trump lead.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Ted Cruz will become the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or that Trump's advantage over Biden will be more than 3 but no more than 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if one of the following conditions is satisfied: (a) Ted Cruz is appointed as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention, a decision made exclusively by the delegates of the convention rather than the individual who is nominated on election day. (b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election exceeds 3 and does not surpass 4, as indicated on the chart for that date when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead.

question.title: Will Russia have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is not assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Ukrainian control of the location or a lack of Russian control of the location

not_P.title: Will Russia not have control of Chasiv Yar on June 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if, when accessed by Metaculus on June 1, 2024, the [Institute for the Study of War (ISW) map](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/36a7f6a6f5a9448496de641cf64bd375) shows the coordinates 48°35'13.7"N 37°50'02.1"E as not under any of the following categories:



- Assessed Russian Advance in Ukraine

- Assessed Russian Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Assessed Russian Control

- Claimed Russian Territory in Ukraine

- Any other categories created by ISW that indicate Russian control of the location



The question will resolve as **No** if the location is assessed to be in any of the categories indicating Russian control, which includes but is not limited to:



- Reported Ukrainian Territorial Gains in the Past 24 Hours

- Claimed Ukrainian Counteroffensives

- Reported Ukrainian Partisan Warfare

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The absence of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be answered with "No" if these criteria are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that might occur after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been disqualified from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15 he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the question will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will the Orlando Magic win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the Orlando Magic not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are not crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are crowned champions.

para_P.title: Are the Orlando Magic going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Orlando Magic are named the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** for any other teams, as they will not be in the running.

question.title: Will the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the New York Knicks not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the New York Knicks are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are still in contention.

para_P.title: Are the New York Knicks going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the New York Knicks are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** if any other teams are the ones that win.

question.title: Will either the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if neither team wins the championship and they are both eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will neither the Orlando Magic nor the New York Knicks win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither the Orlando Magic nor the New York Knicks are crowned the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if either team wins the championship.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks to become champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either the Orlando Magic or the New York Knicks are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** if both teams fail to secure the championship and are eliminated from the competition.

question.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

not_P.title: Before July 1, 2024, will the International Criminal Court not issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

para_P.title: Will any of the specified Israeli leaders have arrest warrants issued by the International Criminal Court prior to July 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the Israeli cabinet members listed below. It will be marked as **No** if that does not occur.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Will a terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

not_P.title: Will no terrorist act occur in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
not_P.body:
The question will resolve as Yes if no terrorist attack in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) injures and/or kills at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen.

An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility of a terrorist incident taking place in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
para_P.body:
The resolution of this inquiry will be Yes if a terrorist incident in [Metropolitan France](https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metropolitan_France) results in injuries and/or fatalities to at least one individual, excluding the terrorist(s), from the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) to the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The answer will be No if the aforementioned conditions are not met.

An occurrence will be classified as a 'terrorist incident' if it is designated as such by any governmental agency of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) the ICC issues arrest warrants for certain Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, or (b) a terrorist act occurs in metropolitan France during the 2024 Summer Olympics?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), or Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). The question will resolve as No if the above does not happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if a terrorist attack in Metropolitan France does not injure and/or kill at least one person, other than the terrorist(s), between, and inclusive of, the day of the Opening Ceremony (26 July 2024) and the day of the Closing Ceremony (11 August 2024). The question will resolve as No if the above does happen. An event will be considered a 'terrorist attack' if it is not described as such by any agency of the State of France, or by the French President, Prime Minister, or a member of the Council of Ministers.

question.title: Will Malta qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they do not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Malta not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Malta does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Malta set to advance to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Malta takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If they fail to qualify, the conclusion will be **No**.

question.title: Will Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Slovenia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Slovenia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If it qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Slovenia set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is formally recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if it fails to qualify, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will either Malta or Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Malta nor Slovenia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Malta participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Slovenia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Malta or Slovenia make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Malta competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having reached the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Slovenia competes in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having reached the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither nation qualifies, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Will Hurd not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

para_P.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; the outcome is strictly based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump provide testimony during the hush money court proceedings?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has given testimony, either in person or virtually, at the [court hearing](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) regarding the alleged "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will either Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Credible sources report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will neither Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Credible sources report that Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the trial concerning the "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Will Hurd becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Donald Trump gives testimony at the hush money trial?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, rather than on who is announced as the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Reliable sources confirm that Donald Trump has provided testimony, either in person or virtually, regarding the trial about the "hush money" payments made to Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 3, based on 538's nationwide polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the context of this inquiry, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be considered a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this question.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

This market will resolve to YES if Biden participates in another in-person interview that lasts at least 45 minutes. If no qualifying interview is published before the market closes at the end of July, it will resolve to NO. 

This market does not account for press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It may include podcast appearances or late-night shows, or interviews that are edited into programs such as 60 Minutes. Nonetheless, there must be a minimum of 45 minutes of new footage featuring Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to be considered valid. For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his participation on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his previous appearances on 60 Minutes have all contained less than 30 minutes of footage of Biden being interviewed.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Chris Christie is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It does not matter who is nominated by the Republicans on the day of the 2024 US election; it is only determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.title: Will 538 Project Trump as the favorite on Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will FiveThirtyEight indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is shown to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden according to the same forecast. In the event that both candidates have equal probabilities, the market will settle at 50-50.

The resolution will rely on the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast, accessible at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically utilizing the figures represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any alterations to the methodology employed by FiveThirtyEight in calculating these figures will not affect the outcome of this market.

This market will resolve based on the data for July 19 as soon as data for July 20 is released. It may remain unresolved until the data for July 20 is available. Should there be no data for July 19 by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the most recent available figures prior to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution pertains to the winning odds of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (e.g., "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will either Tim Scott be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or will 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Tim Scott is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election; (b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024.

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), the resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. The resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (e.g., "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.body:

For part (a), it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

For part (b), the resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market. The resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (e.g., "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either Tim Scott becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that 538 indicates Biden as the frontrunner on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Tim Scott is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election; (b) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump.

Regarding part (a), it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican party on the date of the 2024 US election; the decision is strictly based on the delegates' selection at the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

Concerning part (b), the source for resolution will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, available at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, with a focus on the values represented by the blue and red trend lines for the date of resolution. Any alterations to the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to compute its statistics will not affect the outcome of this market. The resolution will refer to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The number of simulations won by each candidate out of 1,000 will NOT be taken into account.

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

not_P.title: Will no athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

not_P.title: Will the same nation not win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- association football 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **No**.

The question can resolve as soon as it becomes clear one of these conditions will happen (e.g. neither team playing the final of the last event has won any of the others).

para_P.title: Will a single country secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **No** if teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in these eight team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: 

- soccer 
- 3×3 basketball
- 5×5 basketball
- field hockey
- handball 
- rugby sevens
- volleyball
- water polo.

Conversely, if the same NOC wins at least two of these competitions, the question will be answered with **Yes**.

The question can be resolved as soon as it is evident that one of these scenarios will occur (for example, if neither team in the final of the last event has won any of the other competitions).

question.title: Will either an athlete win multiple tennis medals or a nation win multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: 

(a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) The same nation wins gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports.

not_P.title: Will neither an athlete win multiple tennis medals nor a nation win multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: 

(a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) The same nation wins gold in more than one of the following women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. This resolves as **No** if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in these eight team sports.

para_P.title: Will any athlete secure multiple tennis medals or will a country achieve multiple victories in women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: 

(a) An athlete earns a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

(b) A single country claims gold in more than one of these women's team sports at the 2024 Paris Olympics: association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. It is answered with **No** if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in each of these eight team sports.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following happens: (a) Tucker Carlson is chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) On July 15, 2024, Trump's advantage over Biden is more than 3 but not exceeding 4 based on 538's national polling average?

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:

para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group secures the highest number of seats post the 2024 European Parliament elections and will be marked as **No** for any other results. In cases where two groups have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will be answered with **Yes**.

The resolution of this question will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media coverage.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats in the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the proposal to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, as they believe it suppresses the crucial ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain significantly concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He did not confirm whether the letter exists.

This market will resolve to YES if at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Additionally, multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not met by the market close, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple voting rounds during its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If just a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan or will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither of these criteria are met, this question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the early nomination plan nor will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient. (b) The Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If either of these criteria are met, this question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the early nomination strategy, or will there be a brokered convention for Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) By the end of Sunday, July 21st, a public letter denouncing the early nomination strategy receives signatures from no fewer than 20 Democratic House Members or Senators, or if multiple letters collectively gather 20 signatures from lawmakers. (b) The Democratic Party needs to conduct more than one round of voting during its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If neither of these conditions is satisfied, the outcome will be NO.
