question.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).  If no such agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will the Republicans Party of France (Les Républicains) not form a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if before June 30, 2024, no electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If such an agreement is announced, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Les Républicains and the National Rally collaborate for the 2024 French legislative election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, prior to June 30, 2024, there is an official announcement of a coalition or electoral alliance between Les Républicains and the National Rally for the forthcoming [French legislative election](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2024_French_legislative_election), as reported by [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions). If no such coalition is declared, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will the Prime Minister of France belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will the Prime Minister of France not belong to the Together coalition on July 30, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: On July 30, 2024, will the French Prime Minister be a member of the Together coalition?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, at 12:00 Central European Time on July 30th, the Prime Minister of France's party is identified as Together by reliable sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 30, 2024: (a) The Republican Party of France forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If no such agreement is announced, this component resolves as **No**. (b) The party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. If either condition (a) or (b) is met, this question resolves as **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by July 30, 2024: (a) The Republican Party of France forms a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 French legislative election (b) The Prime Minister of France belongs to the Together coalition?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Before June 30, 2024, an electoral alliance or coalition agreement is officially announced between the Republicans Party (Les Républicains) and National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the upcoming French legislative election, according to credible sources. If such an agreement is announced, this component resolves as **Yes**. (b) The party of the Prime Minister of France is Together on July 30th, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources. If the Prime Minister's party is Together, this component resolves as **Yes**. If both conditions (a) and (b) are not met, this question resolves as **Yes**. Otherwise, it resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: By July 30, 2024, will one of the following happen: (a) The Republicans of France will create a political alliance with the National Rally for the 2024 legislative elections in France, or (b) The Prime Minister of France will be part of the Together coalition?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if at least one of the following occurs: (a) An official announcement of an electoral alliance or coalition agreement between the Republicans (Les Républicains) and the National Rally (Rassemblement National) for the forthcoming French legislative election is made before June 30, 2024, based on reliable sources. If no such announcement is made, this part will be marked as **No**. (b) On July 30, 2024, at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France's party is Together, as confirmed by credible sources. If either condition (a) or (b) is satisfied, this question will be marked as **Yes**. If neither is satisfied, it will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 3 but not exceeding 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined based on Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicates Trump is ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would count as a positive value of 2.4 for this question.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Larry Elder not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Larry Elder going to be the GOP candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be answered with **No**. This question is not limited to those candidates currently announced; additional candidates may be considered later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 election; the outcome is solely based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 4 or less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, nor (b) Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is not greater than 3 or not less than or equal to 4 points on July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading.
(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. It is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), not by who receives the nomination on the day of the election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following will happen: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 3 but is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average, or (b) Larry Elder becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) is greater than 3 and equal to or less than 4 points on July 15, 2024, as verified by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, while a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead.
(b) This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the choice of the delegates from the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention), rather than by who is announced as the nominee on election day.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will the 25th Amendment Section 4 be invoked to declare Biden incapacitated prior to August?
para_P.body:
This question is answered with YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his position" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the Presidential office due to death, resignation, etc., is not considered. Biden's activation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also not applicable.

Context: A GOP lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Joe Biden will publicly declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not be accepting the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign releases a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will neither pursue nor accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any doubt regarding Biden's acceptance of the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election.

If such a clear statement is not issued before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 or (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office. 

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024 nor (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count. Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office. 

(b) This question will resolve as **No** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a **No** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either (a) Biden will be recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024, or (b) Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's presidential nomination?
para_P.body:
(a) This will resolve to YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another pertinent authority) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the responsibilities of his office" and appoints the Vice President as Acting President before August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this inquiry. Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc. is not considered. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded. Context: A GOP lawmaker has requested Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position. 

(b) This query will be answered with **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will neither pursue nor accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President in the 2024 election cycle. If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman?
question.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

not_P.title: Will the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee not be a Woman?
not_P.body:
Will resolve “yes” if/when the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

Will resolve “no” if/when the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election.

para_P.title: Will a Woman be the Democratic Presidential Candidate for 2024?
para_P.body:
This will conclude with a “yes” if the Democratic delegates choose a female candidate for the presidential election in 2024.

This will conclude with a “no” if the Democratic delegates choose a male candidate for the presidential election in 2024.

question.title: Will the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question resolves as No if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, voleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will the same nation not win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as Yes if women's teams representing eight different National Olympic Committees (NOC) win gold in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball and water polo.

Otherwise, the same NOC must not have won at least two of these events, so the question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a single country to secure victories in multiple women's team sports during the 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with No if women's teams from eight distinct National Olympic Committees (NOC) achieve gold medals in the eight team sports - association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo.

Conversely, the same NOC must have claimed victory in at least two of these competitions for the answer to be **Yes**.

question.title: Will either the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman or the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs: (a) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics, which include association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. 

The question will resolve as NO if neither (a) nor (b) occurs. Specifically, (a) will resolve as NO if the Democratic delegates select a male presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and (b) will resolve as NO if women's teams representing eight different NOCs win gold in the eight team sports.

not_P.title: Will neither the 2024 Democratic Presidential Nominee be a Woman nor the same nation win more than one women's team sport at the 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) The Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election. (b) The same National Olympic Committee (NOC) wins gold in more than one of the eight women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics, which include association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. 

The question will resolve as NO if either (a) or (b) occurs. Specifically, (a) will resolve as NO if the Democratic delegates select a female presidential nominee for the 2024 election, and (b) will resolve as NO if a single NOC wins gold in more than one of the eight team sports.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democratic candidate for president in 2024 will be a woman, or that the same country will secure victories in multiple women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered TRUE if at least one of the following happens: (a) A female candidate is chosen by the Democratic delegates for the presidential election in 2024. (b) A single National Olympic Committee (NOC) achieves gold medals in more than one of the eight women's team sports at the 2024 Olympics, which encompass association football, 3×3 basketball, 5×5 basketball, field hockey, handball, rugby sevens, volleyball, and water polo. 

This question will be deemed FALSE if neither (a) nor (b) takes place. In particular, (a) will be regarded as FALSE if the Democratic delegates opt for a male candidate for the 2024 presidential election, and (b) will be marked as FALSE if women's teams from eight distinct NOCs win gold in the eight team sports.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is ≤46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will Kamala's chances of victory improve in the upcoming week as per Nate Silver's analysis?
para_P.body:
Determined to be YES if the Electoral College likelihood for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. Determined to be NO in all other cases.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any ambiguity regarding Biden's willingness to accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, (b) Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
question.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model, (b) Joe Biden not announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
not_P.body:
(a) Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign does not make a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Kamala's chances of winning rise in the next week according to Nate Silver's analysis, (b) Joe Biden declares before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be marked as YES if the Electoral College likelihood for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis is greater than 46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will be marked as NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

(b) This question will be marked as **Yes** if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

For a **Yes** resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a clear statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden remain in office as president until the conclusion of July?
para_P.body: This market will settle on yes if Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by fewer than 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s initiative to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they believe suppresses the vital ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that many of their own members are still quite concerned about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He chose not to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination proposal is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who align with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Several such letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also be enough to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will either Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, or at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body: This question resolves to YES if either of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. Multiple letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also suffice. If neither condition is met, this question resolves to NO.

not_P.title: Will neither Joe Biden still be president by the end of July 2024, nor at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body: This question resolves to YES if neither of the following conditions are met: (a) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024. (b) A public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before the end of Sunday, July 21st, 2024. If at least one condition is met, this question resolves to NO.

para_P.title: By the conclusion of July 2024, will Joe Biden remain in the presidency, or will there be at least 20 Democratic lawmakers who publicly oppose the initiative to nominate Biden early?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if one of the following criteria is satisfied: (a) Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31, 2024. (b) Before the end of Sunday, July 21, 2024, a public statement against the early nomination initiative is endorsed by no fewer than 20 House Members or Senators aligned with the Democratic Party. It is also acceptable if multiple statements together gather a total of 20 signatures from lawmakers. If neither of these conditions is fulfilled, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires only one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is a brokered convention expected for the Democrats in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if a single ballot suffices, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This resolves as **Yes** if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are not met by market close, this resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats do not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
(a) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024: This resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this resolves as **No**.

(b) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats do not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: This resolves as **Yes** if no public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. If these criteria are met by market close, this resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024 (b) At least 20 Democratic members of the House or Senate publicly oppose the plan to nominate Biden virtually ahead of time?
para_P.body:
(a) Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024: This will be marked as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than a single round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 presidential election in the United States. If only one ballot is needed, then it will be marked as **No**.

(b) At least 20 Democratic House/Senate members sign a public letter against the plan to nominate Biden early: This will be marked as **Yes** if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by no fewer than 20 members of the House or Senate who are affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. Several letters totaling at least 20 signatures from lawmakers would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. If these conditions are not satisfied by the market close, it will resolve to NO.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a standard Democrat, will he secure at least a 3% increase among Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two polls from Manifold that conclude on July 6. One poll asks Manifold participants to cast their vote alongside Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other requests votes alongside a standard Democrat on a hypothetical ballot.

Public opinion surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump beyond the margin of error, whereas all other Democrats in hypothetical scenarios either lead or are within the margin of error. Do Manifold participants reflect the general populace?

This market will be marked as YES if the proportion of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or greater when both polls conclude.

To calculate the percentage of votes for Trump, the formula is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The outcome is YES if the calculation for the first poll minus the calculation for the second poll is greater than or equal to 0.03. Otherwise, it will be NO.

The polls and this inquiry will never resolve as N/A and will stay open until the designated closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 4, based on 538's average national polls?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is ahead. For instance, as of July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Democrats will need a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if the Democratic Party necessitates multiple rounds of voting in its roll call ballot to officially select its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. Conversely, if only a single ballot is needed, the answer will be **No**.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Democrats have a brokered convention in 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. The lead must be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party requires more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Democrats not have a brokered convention in 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. The lead must be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4.

(b) This question resolves as **Yes** if the Democratic Party does not require more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to formally nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If more than one ballot is required, then this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is at most 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Will the Democrats hold a brokered convention in 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as shown in the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure shows Biden is ahead. The lead must be more than 2 and no greater than 4.

(b) This question will be answered as **Yes** if the Democratic Party needs more than one round of voting in its roll call ballot to officially nominate its candidate for the 2024 US presidential election. If only a single ballot is needed, then this question will be answered as **No**.

question.title: Will Larry Elder be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not testify at the hush money trial?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report Donald Trump has not testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump give testimony in the hush money case?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the [court hearing](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" transactions involving Stormy Daniels.

question.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

not_P.title: Iran military response before August 13th midnight Eastern Time?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. Otherwise, this market will resolve to "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g. if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this market will resolve to "No") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this market.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e. Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this market.

para_P.title: Will Iran conduct military operations prior to midnight on August 13th Eastern Time?
para_P.body:
This market will settle on "Yes" if Iran carries out a military operation on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries between July 30 and August 12, 2024, at 11:59 PM ET. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

For the purposes of this market, a "military operation" is defined as any act of force undertaken by Iran on Israeli land, in its airspace, or within its maritime boundaries (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons facility in Israel, the market will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by a consensus of credible reports. This encompasses, but is not restricted to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground incursions. Cyber operations, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be considered for the resolution of this market.

Only actions by Iranian military forces that are explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or verified to have originated from Iranian territory, will be factored into the resolution of this market. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy groups (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in the resolution of this market.

question.title: Will either Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial or will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (b) Iran initiates a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. 

For the purposes of this component, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g., if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this component will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this component.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this component. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e., Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this component.

not_P.title: Will neither Donald Trump testify at the hush money trial nor will Iran initiate a military action on Israeli territory before August 13, 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) [Credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) report that Donald Trump has testified, whether in person or remotely, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) concerning the so-called "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (b) Iran does not initiate a military action on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. 

For the purposes of this component, a "military action" will be considered to be any use of force executed by Iran on Israeli soil, airspace, or maritime territory (e.g., if a weapons depot on Israeli soil is hit by an Iranian missile, this component will resolve to "Yes") that is officially acknowledged by the Iranian government or a consensus of credible reporting. This includes, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval attacks, or ground invasions. Cyber attacks, sanctions, or diplomatic actions will not count towards the resolution of this component.

Only responses by Iranian forces explicitly claimed by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian territory will count toward the resolution of this component. Attacks on Israel by proxy forces (i.e., Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not count toward the resolution of this component.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will give testimony at the hush money trial or that Iran will launch a military operation on Israeli land prior to August 13, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) [Reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) indicate that Donald Trump has provided testimony, whether in person or via remote means, at the [trial](https://iapps.courts.state.ny.us/webcrim_attorney/Detail?which=case&docketNumber=q23XFOwZRDQ1d4LrNRdw2clqCMt/CzUoG/kRII/7Nmg=&countyId=K4i18rFVPQh5HTQ/kUoO3Q==&docketId=3Y4iKU5oHM75AtDme2cPhw==&docketDseq=T/O1YN_PLUS_BG65HkOeqEnpAkw==&defendantName=TRUMP,+DONALD&court=New+York+Supreme+Criminal+Court&courtType=U&recordType=U&recordNum=) related to the alleged "hush money" payments to Stormy Daniels. (b) Iran launches a military operation on Israeli territory, airspace, or maritime areas between July 30 and August 12, 2024, 11:59 PM ET. 

In this context, a "military operation" will be defined as any force used by Iran on Israeli land, airspace, or maritime regions (for instance, if an Iranian missile strikes a weapons depot in Israel, this will resolve to "Yes") that is officially recognized by the Iranian government or corroborated by credible reporting. This encompasses, but is not limited to, airstrikes, naval assaults, or ground invasions. Cyber warfare, sanctions, or diplomatic measures will not be considered for the resolution of this inquiry.

Only actions by Iranian forces that are explicitly acknowledged by the Islamic Republic of Iran, or confirmed to have originated from Iranian soil will count toward the resolution of this inquiry. Attacks on Israel conducted by proxy forces (such as Hezbollah, Houthis, etc.) will not be included in this resolution.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Albania takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Iceland competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. The response will be **No** if neither Albania nor Iceland secures a spot in the Grand Final.
