question.title: Will Donald Trump be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Donald Trump going to be the nominee for the Republican Party in the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if the Republican National Convention chooses Donald Trump as their nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question may take into account any new candidates that might emerge in the future.

For the purpose of this question, it does not matter who is nominated by the Republican Party on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is only based on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is greater than 75k and less than or equal to 77k, or (b) Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(a) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, will be greater than 75,000 and less than or equal to 77,000.

(b) Donald Trump will be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) On July 21, 2024, the closing value of BSE SENSEX is less than or equal to 75k or greater than 77k, nor (b) Donald Trump is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(a) The closing value of the BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, according to Yahoo Finance, will be less than or equal to 75,000 or greater than 77,000.

(b) Donald Trump will not be selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) The closing price of BSE SENSEX on July 21, 2024, falls between 75,000 and 77,000 inclusive, or (b) Donald Trump becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(a) On July 21, 2024, the BSE SENSEX's closing price, as reported by Yahoo Finance, will be above 75,000 but not exceeding 77,000.

(b) The Republican National Convention will choose Donald Trump as their nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is based solely on the delegates' selection at the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will 538 Project Biden as the favorite on Friday?
question.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

not_P.title: Will 538 Project Biden as not the favorite on Friday?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to “Yes” if Donald Trump has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Joe Biden according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This market will resolve to “No” if Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this market will resolve 50-50.

The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for this market's resolution date. Changes in the methodology by which FiveThirtyEight calculates its figures will have no bearing on the resolution of this market.

This market will resolve according to the datapoints for July 19 as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. This market may not resolve until the July 20 datapoints are available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, this market will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

Please note the resolution refers to the odds of each candidate winning as a number out of 100 reported to the 1 digit mark (eg. "Trump 57 times out of 100"). The listed number of simulations out of 1,000 won by each candidate will NOT be considered.

para_P.title: Will 538 indicate Biden as the frontrunner on Friday?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a “Yes” if Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump, based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. Conversely, it will result in a “No” if Donald Trump is forecasted to have a higher likelihood of winning than Joe Biden according to the same FiveThirtyEight forecast for that date. In the event that both candidates are shown to have equal chances, the market will resolve at 50-50.

The source for resolution will be the FiveThirtyEight 2024 presidential election forecast found at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/, specifically referring to the values represented by the blue and red trend lines on the resolution date. Any changes in the methodology used by FiveThirtyEight to derive its figures will not influence the outcome of this market.

Resolution will take place based on the data for July 19 as soon as the data for July 20 is released. This market might not come to a conclusion until the July 20 data is available. If data for July 19 is not accessible by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the market will resolve based on the closest previous data to July 19.

It is important to note that the resolution will refer to the winning probabilities of each candidate expressed as a number out of 100, rounded to one decimal place (for example, "Trump 57 out of 100"). The number of simulations out of 1,000 that each candidate won will not be taken into account.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will the difference in favor of Trump over Biden be greater than 2 but not exceeding 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, when retrieved by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a Trump advantage, while a negative figure denotes a Biden lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value indicated Trump was 2.4 points ahead of Biden, representing a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: Will either 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, or will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if either of the following conditions is met: (1) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This will be determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/ as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

not_P.title: Will neither 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024, nor will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if neither of the following conditions is met: (1) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This will be determined by the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/ as soon as datapoints for July 20 become available. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the nearest previous figures to July 19 will be used. (2) Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 2 or greater than 4 points as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead.

para_P.title: On July 19, 2024, will 538 indicate that Biden is the frontrunner, or will Trump's advantage over Biden fall between 2 and 4 points on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed "Yes" if at least one of the following criteria is satisfied: (1) Joe Biden is projected to have a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump based on the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for July 19, 2024. This will be assessed using the data represented by the blue and red trend lines on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/2024-election-forecast/ as soon as data for July 20 is accessible. If there are no data points for July 19 available by July 22, 11:59 PM ET, the closest prior figures to July 19 will be utilized. (2) Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is more than 2 and at most 4 points as shown on the chart for July 15, 2024, when viewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024, at https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/. A positive number signifies a Trump advantage, while a negative number indicates a Biden advantage.

question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Francis Suarez is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election. If either event occurs, this question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Francis Suarez becomes the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or that at least 10 Democratic Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if one of the following happens: (a) Francis Suarez is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This decision is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is nominated on election day. (b) Before midnight July 20 Central Time, if 10 or more Democratic Senators request Biden to step aside, as per the source of the resolution: https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2024/us/elections/biden-drop-out-democrats.html. If neither of these scenarios takes place, the resolution will be **No**.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker asks Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office

not_P.title: Will Biden not be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

Context: GOP lawmaker does not ask Merrick Garland to invoke 25th Amendment to remove Biden from office.

para_P.title: Will Biden be recognized as incapacitated according to Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate body) activates Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and allows the Vice President to take on the role of Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The length of the incapacity is irrelevant to this inquiry.

Biden leaving the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., is not included. Biden's own invocation of Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

Context: A Republican lawmaker requests Merrick Garland to invoke the 25th Amendment to remove Biden from his position.

question.title: Will either Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August or 538 project Biden as the favorite on July 19, 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc. does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden has a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This resolves to YES if Joe Biden is projected as the favorite over Donald Trump by FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast for July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this resolves 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, this will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

(a) Biden is declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024. This occurs if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) do not invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and do not cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time). The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc. does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

(b) Joe Biden does not have a higher probability of winning the US presidential election than Donald Trump according to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast for the day of July 19, 2024. This resolves to YES if Joe Biden is not projected as the favorite over Donald Trump by FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast for July 19, 2024. If Biden and Trump have equal odds, this resolves 50-50. The resolution source will be FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the numbers indicated by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. If no datapoints for July 19 are available by July 22, this will resolve according to the nearest previous figures to July 19.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Biden will be deemed incapacitated as per Section 4 of the 25th Amendment prior to August, or that FiveThirtyEight will show Biden as the leading candidate on July 19, 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if one of the following conditions is met:

(a) Biden is recognized as incapacitated under Section 4 of the 25th Amendment before August 2024. This situation arises if the Vice President along with a majority of the Cabinet (or another appropriate authority) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to officially state that "the President is unable to fulfill the powers and responsibilities of his office" and appoint the Vice President as Acting President, prior to August 2024 (Eastern time). The length of the incapacity is irrelevant for this question. Biden's departure from the presidency due to death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment is also excluded.

(b) According to the FiveThirtyEight election forecast on July 19, 2024, Joe Biden has a greater chance of winning the US presidential election compared to Donald Trump. This will be considered a YES if FiveThirtyEight's forecast for the 2024 presidential election on July 19, 2024, indicates that Joe Biden is favored over Donald Trump. If both candidates are shown to have equal chances, this will be treated as a 50-50 outcome. The resolution will be based on FiveThirtyEight's 2024 presidential election forecast, specifically the data represented by the blue and red trend lines for July 19, 2024. If there are no data points available for July 19 by July 22, the resolution will rely on the closest preceding figures to July 19.

question.title: Will Luxembourg qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the ID political faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will conclude as **No** for any other political factions. In the event that two factions are tied in seat count, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This inquiry resolves based on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

not_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement not be approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA) the Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote, according to reports from credible sources.

para_P.title: Will the Pandemic Agreement receive approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the Pandemic Agreement is sanctioned through a vote at the World Health Assembly (WHA) in May 2024, based on information from reliable sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats. If two groups are tied for seats, this will also resolve as **Yes**. The resolution will be based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. (b) The Pandemic Agreement is approved in a vote during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), according to reports from credible sources. If either (a) or (b) occurs, this question resolves as **Yes**.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) The Pandemic Agreement is approved at the May 2024 World Health Assembly?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. This will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group does not hold the most seats. If two groups are tied for seats, this will also resolve as **Yes**. The resolution will be based on [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports. (b) The Pandemic Agreement is not approved in a vote during the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), according to reports from credible sources. If neither (a) nor (b) occurs, this question resolves as **Yes**.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the following will happen: (a) The ID political group secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections (b) The Pandemic Agreement receives approval at the World Health Assembly in May 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) The ID political group attains the highest seat count after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will be marked as **Yes** if the ID political group has the most seats. A situation where two groups share the highest number of seats will also result in a **Yes**. The decision will rely on [official announcements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or trustworthy media coverage. (b) The Pandemic Agreement is endorsed through a vote at the May 2024 World Health Assembly (WHA), as reported by reliable sources. If either (a) or (b) occurs, the answer to this question will be **Yes**.

question.title: Will Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.body:

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Will Hurd going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will be marked as **No**. This question is open to the possibility of other candidates being introduced in the future, beyond those listed currently.

For the purposes of this inquiry, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; the determination is based solely on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

question.title: Will either Will Hurd be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Will Hurd is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive, leaving no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If neither of these events occurs, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following conditions is met: (a) Will Hurd is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, a decision made solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. (b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, declaring that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive, leaving no possibility that Biden would accept the nomination. If neither of these scenarios takes place, the question will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The lack of removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The disqualification or prevention is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media reports. Speculative articles, opinion pieces, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution.

The inquiry will be deemed "No" if these conditions are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It strictly relates to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is disqualified or prevented from a ballot and then later reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not disqualified or prevented from any ballot, the inquiry resolves negatively.

question.title: Will either Elon Musk appear at the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 or Donald Trump be removed from a primary election ballot under the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if either of the following occurs:

(a) Elon Musk becomes a guest on the official stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, one of the largest Bitcoin conferences, taking place on July 25-27, 2024.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs:

The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution. Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur after the mentioned date. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

para_P.title: Is it possible for either Elon Musk to take part in the Bitcoin Nashville 2024 event or Donald Trump to be disqualified from a primary election ballot based on the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if one of the following happens:

(a) Elon Musk is featured as a speaker on the main stage of the Bitcoin Nashville 2024, which is among the largest Bitcoin conferences, scheduled for July 25-27, 2024.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump is officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) due to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. This disqualification or prevention must be validated through official announcements from state governments, court rulings, legal documents, or trustworthy media coverage. Speculative information, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not be adequate for resolution. Note: This question does not consider any legal disputes, appeals, or later reversals that may occur after the specified date. question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Czechia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Czechia going to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Czechia takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If Czechia fails to qualify, the outcome will be **No**.

question.title: Will San Marino qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will San Marino not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if San Marino does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Otherwise, it will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is San Marino set to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if San Marino competes in a Semi-final and is formally declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024. If not, it will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will either Czechia or San Marino qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Czechia nor San Marino qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Czechia nor San Marino qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) San Marino participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia or San Marino qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will either Czechia or San Marino make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following takes place: (a) Czechia competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) San Marino competes in a Semi-final and is confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having secured a spot in the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Czechia nor San Marino secures a spot, the inquiry will be answered with **No**.

question.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Not Maintain Its EU Plurality from Hungary in 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if, following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance does not secure more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby not maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Will Fidesz-KDNP Preserve Its Majority in the EU from Hungary in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if, after the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains more seats than any other individual party or coalition, thus continuing to hold the greatest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, as per reliable sources.

question.title: Will the European Union announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will the European Union not announce new tariffs or duties on imports of Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has not announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the European Union will declare new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if, before July 5, 2024, reliable sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has made an announcement regarding the implementation of new tariffs or duties affecting the import of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024, or (b) the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if either of the following occurs: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources; or (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Fidesz-KDNP maintains its EU plurality from Hungary in 2024, nor (b) the EU announces new tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles before July 5, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve to "Yes" if neither of the following occurs: (a) Following the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP alliance secures more seats than any other single party or coalition, thereby maintaining the highest number of Hungarian seats in the European Parliament, according to credible sources; nor (b) Before July 5, 2024, credible sources report that the European Union (EU) has announced that new tariffs or duties will be imposed that would apply to imports of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following will happen: (a) Fidesz-KDNP keeps its status as the largest Hungarian party in the EU after the 2024 elections, or (b) the EU reveals new tariffs on electric vehicles from China prior to July 5, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a "Yes" if at least one of the following takes place: (a) After the 2024 European Parliament elections, the Fidesz-KDNP coalition obtains a greater number of seats than any other party or coalition, thus retaining the largest share of Hungarian representation in the European Parliament, based on reliable sources; or (b) Before July 5, 2024, trustworthy sources indicate that the European Union (EU) has declared the introduction of new tariffs or duties on the importation of Chinese electric vehicles into the EU.

question.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain at least 3% among Manifold respondents?
question.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by 3% or more when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 >= 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

not_P.title: Facing Joe Biden instead of a generic Democrat, will Trump gain less than 3% among Manifold respondents?
not_P.body:
There are two Manifold polls posted, which both close on July 6.  One of the polls asks Manifold respondents to vote with Joe Biden on a hypothetical ballot, and another asks respondents to vote with a generic Democrat on the hypothetical ballot.

@/SteveSokolowski/1-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul@/SteveSokolowski/2-of-2-given-these-choices-who-woul 

Public opinion polls consistently show Joe Biden losing to Donald Trump outside the margin of error, but every other Democrat hypothetically surveyed polls ahead or within the margin of error.  Are Manifold respondents representative of the general public?

This market will resolve YES if the percentage of votes for Donald Trump in poll 1 exceeds that in poll 2 by less than 3% when both polls close.

The formula for determining the percentage of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in the question) + Someone else)).  The answer is YES if this formula for poll 1 - the formula for poll 2 < 0.03.  Otherwise, it is NO.

The polls and this question will never resolve N/A, and will remain open until the close time no matter what.

para_P.title: If Trump competes against Joe Biden rather than a typical Democrat, will he achieve a minimum of 3% more support from Manifold participants?
para_P.body:
There are two polls from Manifold that will conclude on July 6. One poll requests Manifold participants to select Joe Biden on a theoretical ballot, while the other asks them to choose a standard Democrat on a similar hypothetical ballot.

Public sentiment surveys consistently indicate that Joe Biden is trailing Donald Trump by a margin greater than the error range, while every other Democrat surveyed hypothetically either leads or is within the error margin. Are the responses from Manifold participants indicative of the wider public opinion?

This market will be marked as YES if the share of votes for Donald Trump in the first poll surpasses that in the second poll by 3% or more when both polls conclude.

The calculation for determining the share of votes for Trump is (Trump / (Trump + (the Democrat in question) + Someone else)). The result is YES if the calculation for poll 1 minus the calculation for poll 2 is greater than or equal to 0.03. If not, the result will be NO.

The polls and this question will not resolve to N/A and will stay open until the specified closing time regardless of circumstances.

question.title: Will a group of at least 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
question.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of at least five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is not sufficient for a YES resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will not satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving NO. 

If these criteria are not met before July 20th, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will a group of fewer than 5 named Dem House Members or US Senators not pressure Biden to drop out before July 20th?
not_P.body:
Politico reports:

Two safe-seat members have already publicly urged Biden out. Two of the most endangered Democrats told local news outlets they’ve already written off Biden’s chances to win in November.

Behind the scenes, things are even more frenzied. There are multiple drafts of letters circulating among House Democrats and at least one would call on Biden to end his campaign, according to five people familiar with the efforts.

This market resolves YES if a group of fewer than five named Democratic Party US House Members/US Senators do not work together to ask Joe Biden to consider ending his 2024 re-election campaign, or to urge him to do so, before Saturday July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could be by not signing a letter like what is reported above, but it could also be in another form such as a group not speaking with Biden in person and collectively asking him to drop out.

This market requires that all five individuals not be part of the same group message. Five people separately telling reporters they think Biden should drop out is sufficient for a NO resolution.

Reports of any number of unnamed democrats writing to Biden and asking him to step aside will satisfy this market's criteria unless at least 5 qualifying names are later made public before this market's end date. In any ambiguous cases where such names are reported but not confirmed beyond a reasonable doubt, this market will err towards resolving YES. 

If these criteria are met before July 20th, this market resolves YES.

para_P.title: Will at least five identified Democratic House Members or Senators urge Biden to withdraw before July 20th?
para_P.body:
According to Politico:

Two members from secure districts have already publicly called for Biden to step aside. Additionally, two of the most vulnerable Democrats have expressed to local media that they believe Biden's chances of winning in November are slim.

Behind closed doors, the situation is even more chaotic. There are several versions of letters being shared among House Democrats, and at least one of these would request Biden to terminate his campaign, as reported by five sources familiar with the discussions.

This market will resolve to YES if a coalition of at least five specified Democratic Party US House Members or Senators collectively ask Joe Biden to contemplate ending his 2024 re-election bid, or to encourage him to do so, prior to Saturday, July 20th (Pacific Time).

This could occur through signing a letter, as mentioned above, or through another method such as a group meeting with Biden to collectively request his withdrawal.

For a YES resolution, all five individuals must be part of the same unified message. If five individuals independently express to reporters their belief that Biden should withdraw, that will not be adequate for a YES outcome.

Reports of any number of unnamed Democrats reaching out to Biden to request he step aside will not meet the criteria for this market unless at least five qualifying names are disclosed publicly before the market closes. In cases where names are reported but not confirmed with certainty, this market will lean towards a NO resolution.

If these conditions are not satisfied by July 20th, this market will resolve to NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for either of the following to take place: (a) Trump to increase his support by at least 3% among Manifold participants when compared to a generic Democrat, or (b) a coalition of no fewer than 5 identified Democratic House Members or US Senators to press Biden to withdraw from the race before July 20th?

question.title: Will Biden drop out before July 20?
question.body: If Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

not_P.title: Will Biden not drop out before July 20?
not_P.body: If Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20 midnight Eastern Time, this market will resolve to yes. Otherwise, this market will resolve to no.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Biden will withdraw from the race prior to July 20?
para_P.body: Should Biden decide to withdraw or is rendered incapable of continuing his campaign before midnight Eastern Time on July 20, this market will conclude with a yes. If not, the market will conclude with a no.

question.title: Will Mike Pence be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Mike Pence not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently below; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Mike Pence going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No** answer. This question is open to the possibility of additional candidates being included in the future.

It is important to note that the determination of who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election is not relevant; the outcome is solely based on the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Biden drops out before July 20, 2024, or (b) Mike Pence is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body: (a) Biden drops out or is otherwise unable to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) Mike Pence is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Biden does not drop out before July 20, 2024, and (b) Mike Pence is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: (a) Biden does not drop out and is able to continue the race before July 20, 2024, midnight Eastern Time. (b) Mike Pence is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either of these events will take place: (a) Biden withdraws from the race prior to July 20, 2024, or (b) Mike Pence becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: (a) Biden withdraws or is otherwise incapacitated from continuing his campaign before July 20, 2024, at midnight Eastern Time. (b) Mike Pence is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

question.title: Will Poland qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?

question.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
question.body:
Analysts are projecting a huge opening weekend for "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn between $340 million and $360 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with $160 million to $170 million, making it the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie top these marks? It will probably be close...

It will certainly play at more theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) reports it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend

not_P.title: Will Deadpool & Wolverine not have biggest opening weekend ever for R-rated movie? [not ahead of Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
not_P.body:
Analysts are projecting that "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover movie will not have a huge opening weekend.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

The film, directed by Shawn Levy and starring Ryan Reynolds, is projected to earn less than $340 million globally in its opening weekend. This would mean it does not mark the biggest opening weekend ever for an R-rated movie. Domestically, the film is expected to debut with less than $160 million, making it not the biggest R-rated opening of all-time.

"""

[image]The record for biggest opening weekend for an R-rated movie is the original Deadpool at $284.5M ($152.2M domestic).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the new movie not top these marks? It will probably be far off...

It will certainly play at fewer theaters... Deadpool was a smash hit at the time, and a bit surprising.

Since BoxOfficeMojo is a bit weird on reporting international opening weekends -- it provides the raw numbers but aggregates them weirdly -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to let us know what the weekend opening was.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will resolve YES if Deadpool x Wolverine grosses less than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or equivalent publication) does not report it as the record for an R-rated movie release

In other words the BoxOfficeMojo numbers should be seen as unofficial until there's confirmation in the Hollywood press. And the number we shoot for is < $284.5M internationally... this weekend.

para_P.title: Will the crossover of Deadpool and Wolverine achieve the highest opening weekend in history for an R-rated film? [surpassing Deadpool I & II, It, Joker]
para_P.body:
Experts are forecasting an enormous opening weekend for the "Deadpool x Wolverine" crossover film.
https://deepnewz.com/movies/deadpool-wolverine-set-record-360m-global-opening-weekend-biggest-r-rated-debut

"""

This film, helmed by Shawn Levy and featuring Ryan Reynolds, is anticipated to generate between $340 million and $360 million worldwide during its debut weekend. This would set a record for the largest opening weekend ever for an R-rated film. In the U.S., the film is projected to launch with $160 million to $170 million, making it the top R-rated opening in history.

"""

[image]The current record for the largest opening weekend for an R-rated film is held by the original Deadpool, which earned $284.5M ($152.2M domestically).

https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/movies/movie-news/box-office-deadpool-makes-history-865143/

[image]
Will the upcoming film exceed these figures? It seems likely to be very close...

It will definitely be shown in more theaters... Deadpool was a massive success at the time, and somewhat unexpected.

Given that BoxOfficeMojo has an unusual method of reporting international opening weekends -- it lists the raw figures but aggregates them in a peculiar way -- we will wait for Hollywood Reporter to confirm the weekend's opening numbers.

To clarify on resolution...
-> this market will conclude YES if Deadpool x Wolverine earns more than $284.5M globally this opening weekend according to reports
-> AND the Hollywood Reporter (or a similar publication) recognizes it as the record for an R-rated film release

In other words, the BoxOfficeMojo figures should be considered unofficial until confirmed by the Hollywood press. The target number we are looking for is >$284.5M internationally... this weekend.

question.title: Will Greens–EFA hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the Greens–EFA political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections and as **No** for all other outcomes. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will Greens–EFA not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:

para_P.title: Will the Greens–EFA be the leading group in terms of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:

This question will be resolved based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
question.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries (as was the case in Italy in early 2023), or unavailable to (for example) minors, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves positively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

not_P.title: Will OpenAI's ChatGPT not be generally available in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is not generally available in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** otherwise.

"Generally available" here means that the default state for people in the EU is that they cannot access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If available in certain EU countries, or available to (for example) minors, this will still resolve negatively, assuming at least >50% of the population cannot use it.

"ChatGPT" here refers to the general web interface (not the API) for interacting with GPT models. Still resolves negatively if the name or website has changed, as long as OpenAI's service is substantially the same (entering queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

para_P.title: Will ChatGPT by OpenAI be accessible to users in the European Union on June 30, 2024?
para_P.body:
The answer will be **YES** if [ChatGPT](chat.openai.com) is accessible to users in the EU on June 30, 2024, and **NO** in all other cases.

Here, "accessible" means that the standard condition for individuals in the EU is that they can use it without needing a VPN (it may require a payment). If it is not available in some EU nations (as seen in Italy in early 2023), or if it is not accessible to certain groups (like minors), it will still be considered a positive outcome if over 50% of the population has access.

"ChatGPT" refers to the standard web interface (not the API) for engaging with GPT models. It will still be a positive outcome if the name or website changes, provided that OpenAI's service remains fundamentally the same (submitting queries to systems based on Large Language Models).

"Generally available" means that the default state for people in the EU is that they can access it without a VPN (possibly requiring paying for it.) If unavailable in certain EU countries, or unavailable to certain groups, this will still resolve positively, assuming at least >50% of the population can use it. question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden be more than 2 but at most 3, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as documented in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a Trump advantage, whereas a negative figure signifies Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure shows Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would translate to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

question.title: On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
