question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be larger than Apple's?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is greater than that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) On June 28th, 2024, will Nvidia's market capitalization be less than or equal to Apple's?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, the market cap of Nvidia is less than or equal to that of Apple, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when checked by Metaculus at approximately 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

para_P.title: Is it possible that either of the following happens: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is no more than 3 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) On June 28, 2024, will Nvidia's market value surpass that of Apple's?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will conclude as Donald Trump's margin over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For this question, a positive figure indicates a Trump lead, while a negative figure indicates Biden is ahead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported figure for that date shows Trump 2.4 points in front of Biden, which would translate to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purposes of this inquiry.

(b) This question will resolve as **Yes** if, on June 28, 2024, Nvidia's market capitalization is higher than Apple's, according to [Companies Market Cap](https://companiesmarketcap.com/), when verified by Metaculus around 4 PM EDT (8 PM UTC).

question.title: Will Czechia qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Czechia not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Czechia does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Czechia qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Czechia to make it to the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a **Yes** if Czechia competes in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Czechia fails to qualify, the question will be answered with a **No**.

question.title: Will Azerbaijan qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is then officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Azerbaijan does not qualify, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will Azerbaijan not qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if Azerbaijan does not participate in a Semi-final or is not officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If Azerbaijan qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Is Azerbaijan set to advance to the Grand Final at Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as **Yes** if Azerbaijan takes part in a Semi-final and is subsequently confirmed by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having made it to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. Conversely, if Azerbaijan fails to qualify, the inquiry will be marked as **No**.

question.title: Will either Czechia or Azerbaijan qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Czechia nor Azerbaijan qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Czechia nor Azerbaijan qualify for the Grand Final in Eurovision 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Czechia participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Azerbaijan participates in a Semi-final and is officially announced by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having qualified for the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If either Czechia or Azerbaijan qualifies, the question will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: Will Czechia or Azerbaijan make it to the Grand Final of Eurovision 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be determined as **Yes** if one of the following conditions is met: (a) Czechia takes part in a Semi-final and is officially declared by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having reached the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. (b) Azerbaijan competes in a Semi-final and is officially recognized by the European Broadcasting Union (EBU) as having advanced to the Eurovision 2024 Grand Final. If neither Czechia nor Azerbaijan advances, the inquiry will be resolved as **No**.

question.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%? ("Certified Fresh")
question.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or higher, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

not_P.title: Will "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of less than 75%?
not_P.body:
"Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page

This resolves YES if the Tomatometer score is below 75%, one week after release (July 26th). 

Details 

I will use whatever precision is listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal).

For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. This is the equivalent score I will use.

"Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes (AFAIK, it requires >=75% Tomatometer, but there might be other restrictions—the market resolves solely based on the displayed score).

"Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

para_P.title: Will the critics' rating for "Twisters" (2024) on Rotten Tomatoes reach 75% or more? ("Certified Fresh")
para_P.body:
The Rotten Tomatoes page for "Twisters" (2024)

This will be considered a YES if the Tomatometer score is 75% or above, one week post-release (July 26th). 

Further Information 

I will adhere to the precision indicated by Rotten Tomatoes (usually presented as a whole number percentage, without decimals).

For instance, the original "Twister" (1996) has a current Tomatometer score of 63%. This is the score I will reference.

The term "Certified Fresh" is used here for illustration only (to my knowledge, it requires a score of 75% or higher, but there may be additional criteria—the market resolves strictly based on the shown score).

"Twisters" (2024) serves as a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), featuring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

not_P.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" not be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is not higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

para_P.title: Will the opening weekend earnings of "Deadpool & Wolverine" surpass the combined total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body: This question will be answered with **Yes** if the reported opening weekend earnings for **Deadpool & Wolverine** on Boxofficemojo, found on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1), exceed $185,548,391, which is the total of the opening earnings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 plus $53,113,752.

question.title: Will either "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%, or "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs:

(a) "Twisters" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% one week after its release (July 26th). The score will be taken from the "Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page, using the precision listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal). For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. "Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes, but the market resolves solely based on the displayed score. "Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

(b) The domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. The box office opening will be reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page.

not_P.title: Will neither "Twisters" (2024) have a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75%, nor "Deadpool & Wolverine" have a higher domestic box office opening than "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs:

(a) "Twisters" (2024) has a Rotten Tomatoes critics score of at least 75% one week after its release (July 26th). The score will be taken from the "Twisters" (2024) Rotten Tomatoes page, using the precision listed by Rotten Tomatoes (typically an integer percentage, no decimal). For example, the original "Twister" (1996) currently has a Tomatometer of 63%. "Certified Fresh" is just used for illustrative purposes, but the market resolves solely based on the displayed score. "Twisters" (2024) is a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), starring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

(b) The domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** is not higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. The box office opening will be reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page.

para_P.title: Will the Rotten Tomatoes critics score for "Twisters" (2024) reach at least 75%, or will the domestic box office opening for "Deadpool & Wolverine" exceed the combined total of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine"?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) The Rotten Tomatoes critics score for "Twisters" (2024) achieves a minimum of 75% one week post-release (July 26th). The score will be sourced from the "Twisters" (2024) page on Rotten Tomatoes, utilizing the precision provided by Rotten Tomatoes (usually an integer percentage, no decimals). For instance, the original "Twister" (1996) currently holds a Tomatometer of 63%. The designation of "Certified Fresh" is merely for illustrative purposes; the resolution of the market will depend solely on the displayed score. "Twisters" (2024) serves as a standalone sequel to the 1996 original, directed by Lee Isaac Chung ("Minari"), featuring Glen Powell ("Top Gun: Maverick") and Daisy Edgar Jones ("Normal People").

(b) The domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** surpasses $185,548,391, which is the total of the box office openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. The box office opening will be reported by Boxofficemojo on the respective movie's page.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be 2 or less, or greater than 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not go beyond 3, based on 538's average of national polls?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved based on the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in the 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as presented in the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies that Biden is in the lead. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which translates to a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the date of this question's release and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an offensive attributed to Israel and taking place within the territory of Iran has resulted in the fatalities of at least five people.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 3 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

(b) This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible for one of the following scenarios to take place: (a) Trump's margin over Biden exceeds 2 but does not go beyond 3 by July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Will Israel execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be resolved based on the lead of Donald Trump over Joe Biden as per 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as displayed on the chart for July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024. A positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, while a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump ahead of Biden by 2.4 points, which would correspond to a positive figure of 2.4 for the purpose of this inquiry.

(b) This question will be answered **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, credible evidence suggests that an attack attributed to Israel has occurred within the territory of Iran, resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will the Indiana Pacers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if the Indiana Pacers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the Indiana Pacers not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body:
The question resolves as **Yes** if the Indiana Pacers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It resolves as **No** for all other teams if they are crowned the champion.

para_P.title: Are the Indiana Pacers going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body:
This question will be answered with **Yes** if the Indiana Pacers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). 

It will be answered with **No** for any other teams that do not win.

question.title: Will the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: The question resolves as Yes if the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as No for all other teams as they are eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will the Los Angeles Clippers not win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: The question resolves as Yes if the Los Angeles Clippers are not crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as No for all other teams if they are crowned champion.

para_P.title: Are the Los Angeles Clippers going to be the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: The answer will be Yes if the Los Angeles Clippers are declared the winners of the 2024 NBA Finals, based on information from [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). Any other outcome, where they are not the champions, results in a No.

question.title: Will either the Indiana Pacers or the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either the Indiana Pacers or the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if neither team wins and they are both eliminated from contention.

not_P.title: Will neither the Indiana Pacers nor the Los Angeles Clippers win the 2024 NBA Finals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither the Indiana Pacers nor the Los Angeles Clippers are crowned the champion of the 2024 NBA Finals, according to [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It resolves as **No** if either team wins and they are both in contention.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the Indiana Pacers or the Los Angeles Clippers to secure victory in the 2024 NBA Finals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either the Indiana Pacers or the Los Angeles Clippers become the champions of the 2024 NBA Finals, as per [the NBA](https://www.nba.com/). It will be answered with **No** if both teams do not win and are eliminated from the competition.

question.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidate being selected will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Tucker Carlson not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Tucker Carlson is selected, this will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Tucker Carlson going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will result in **Yes** if Tucker Carlson is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 United States Presidential Election. Any other individual being chosen will result in **No**. This inquiry is not limited to the candidates currently announced; additional candidates may be introduced later.

For this inquiry, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; the determination is based solely on who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that a person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will the Republican Party not retain Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as Yes if credible sources report that no person representing the Republican Party has won the special election for OH's 6th district. If popular sources are in disagreement, an Ohio State source or statement will be used. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will the GOP maintain control of Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly occupied by Bill Johnson) during the special election in 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmed if reliable sources indicate that an individual affiliated with the GOP has secured victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th district. In the event of conflicting reports from popular sources, an official Ohio State source or declaration will be referenced. Should no election take place prior to January 1, 2025, this question will be rendered void.

question.title: Will either Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (b) A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in 2024. This is based on credible reports, with Ohio State sources used in case of disagreement. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

not_P.title: Will neither Tucker Carlson be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor will the Republican Party retain Ohio's 6th congressional district in the 2024 special election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Tucker Carlson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who receives the nomination on the day of the election. (b) A person representing the Republican Party wins the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (previously held by Bill Johnson) in 2024. This is based on credible reports, with Ohio State sources used in case of disagreement. If no election is held before January 1, 2025, the question is annulled.

para_P.title: Will Tucker Carlson be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or will the GOP keep Ohio's 6th congressional district in the special election of 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered as **Yes** if either of the following happens: (a) Tucker Carlson is nominated by the Republican National Convention for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This is determined by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is announced as the nominee on the election day. (b) A candidate from the Republican Party secures victory in the special election for Ohio's 6th congressional district (formerly held by Bill Johnson) in 2024. This is based on reliable information, with Ohio State sources being referenced in case of any disputes. If no election occurs before January 1, 2025, the question will be void.

question.title:
Will the  CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS)	
 be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023.

not_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) be lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The reported number for July 20, 2024 must be less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023.

para_P.title: Will the CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) see an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024?
para_P.body: The resolution of this inquiry will depend on the data provided by the St. Louis Fed at this link: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS. The figure reported for July 20, 2024 must exceed the figure reported on July 20, 2023.

question.title: Will Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will Israel not carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves **Yes** if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body: This question will be resolved as **Yes** if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports confirm that an assault attributed to Israel has taken place within Iran, resulting in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
question.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be considered higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024 if the reported number for that date is greater than the reported number on July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.
(b) Israel will be considered to have carried out a deadly attack within Iran if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, credible reports indicate that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index be higher Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? (b) Israel carry out a deadly attack within Iran before May 1, 2024?
not_P.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be considered lower Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024 if the reported number for that date is less than or equal to the reported number on July 20, 2023, based on reporting by the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.
(b) Israel will be considered to have not carried out a deadly attack within Iran if, following the date of this question's publication and before May 1, 2024, there are no credible reports indicating that an attack attributed to Israel and occurring within Iran's borders has led to the death of at least five individuals.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following events will happen: (a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index will show an increase Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024? (b) Israel will execute a lethal strike inside Iran prior to May 1, 2024?
para_P.body:
(a) The CBOE S&P 500 3-Month Volatility Index (VXVCLS) will be regarded as increased Year-over-Year on July 20, 2024 if the figure reported on that date surpasses the figure reported on July 20, 2023, according to data from the St. Louis Fed here: https://fred.stlouisfed.org/series/VXVCLS.
(b) Israel will be deemed to have conducted a lethal strike within Iran if, after the publication date of this question and before May 1, 2024, reliable reports suggest that an attack attributed to Israel that took place within Iran's territory resulted in the deaths of at least five people.

question.title: Will Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Nikki Haley not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Nikki Haley is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Nikki Haley is selected, this question will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Will Nikki Haley be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered **Yes** if Nikki Haley is appointed by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently acknowledged; additional options may emerge later.

For the purpose of this inquiry, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is irrelevant; it is determined exclusively by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Will Joe Biden still be president by the end of July?
question.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden no longer be president by the end of July?
not_P.body: This market will resolve yes if at 11:59 pm on July 31st 2024 if Joe Biden is no longer officially president of the United States.

para_P.title: Is Joe Biden expected to remain president until the end of July?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a yes if, at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024, Joe Biden is still the officially recognized president of the United States.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Nikki Haley is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden is still president by the end of July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions is met: (a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Joe Biden is still officially president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of these will happen: (a) Nikki Haley becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election (b) Joe Biden remains president until the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be resolved as **Yes** if at least one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) Nikki Haley is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, irrespective of who holds the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) Joe Biden is still the official president of the United States at 11:59 pm on July 31st, 2024.

question.title: Will Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body:
Resolves YES if there is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not die before Saturday?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if there is no official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. 

Otherwise, resolves NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Joe Biden will pass away prior to Saturday?
para_P.body:
This will be confirmed with a YES if there is an official declaration regarding Joe Biden's death before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. 

If not, it will be confirmed with a NO.

question.title: Will either Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden die before Saturday?
question.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The nomination is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. If neither event occurs, this question resolves as **No**.

not_P.title: Will neither Nikki Haley be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor Joe Biden die before Saturday?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The nomination is determined solely by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, regardless of who is the nominee on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) There is an official announcement of Joe Biden's death before market close at the end of Friday, July 26th. If either event occurs, this question resolves as **No**.

para_P.title: Is it possible that Nikki Haley becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election or that Joe Biden passes away before Saturday?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following takes place: (a) Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. The selection is made exclusively by the delegates of the Republican National Convention, irrespective of who is the candidate on the day of the 2024 US election. (b) An official statement regarding Joe Biden's death is made before the market closes on Friday, July 26th. If neither of these events happens, the answer to this inquiry will be **No**.

question.title: Will Paris Saint-Germain win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: The question resolves "Yes" if Paris Saint-Germain wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other outcomes resolve "No".

not_P.title: Will Paris Saint-Germain not win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
not_P.body: The question resolves "Yes" if Paris Saint-Germain does not win the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other outcomes resolve "Yes".

para_P.title: Is it possible for Paris Saint-Germain to take the title in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with "Yes" if Paris Saint-Germain secures victory in the Final on June 1, 2024, as per [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). Any other result will lead to a "No" answer.

question.title: Will Bayern Munich win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?
question.body: The question resolves "Yes" if Bayern Munich wins the Final on the 1st of June 2024, according to [UEFA](https://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/). All other teams resolve "No".

not_P.title: Will Bayern Munich not win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?

not_P.title: Will neither Paris Saint-Germain nor Bayern Munich win the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?

para_P.title: Is it possible for either Paris Saint-Germain or Bayern Munich to emerge victorious in the 2023/2024 UEFA Champions League?

question.title: Will an athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

not_P.title: Will no athlete win more than one medal for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if no athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

para_P.title: Is it possible for an athlete to secure multiple medals in tennis during the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if any athlete achieves a minimum of two medals in tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win <21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 21 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No". 

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won fewer than 21 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve at Least 21 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes earn 21 or more gold medals during the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The resolution will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions) if the IOC's reporting is not available. If not, the market will be resolved as "No". 

Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have secured 21 or more gold medals before the Games conclude, the market will promptly resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, or (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) an athlete wins more than one medal for tennis, nor (b) Individual Neutral Athletes win 21 or more gold medals?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Any athlete wins at least two medals for tennis at the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 21 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution for (b) will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 21 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "No".

para_P.title: Is it possible that at the 2024 Paris Olympics, (a) a tennis player secures more than one medal, or (b) Individual Neutral Athletes achieve 21 or more gold medals?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if either of the following happens: (a) Any tennis player earns at least two medals during the 2024 Paris Olympics. (b) The total number of gold medals won by Individual Neutral Athletes reaches 21 or more at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The determination for (b) will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. If it is confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 21 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, the market will promptly resolve to "Yes".

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 2 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 2 but not surpass 4 according to the national polling average from 538?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden as indicated by 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) on the chart dated July 15, 2024, which will be reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure indicates a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure signifies a lead for Biden. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the recorded value shows Trump leading by 2.4 points over Biden, resulting in a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body: If Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to no. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body: If Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP, this market will resolve to yes. If someone else is selected as VP, this market will resolve to yes. If the VP is changed for any reason after the initial nomination, that will not change the resolution of this market. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is Kamala Harris going to be the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body: This market will conclude with a 'yes' if Kamala Harris receives the nomination for Democratic Vice President. Conversely, if a different candidate is chosen for the VP position, the market will conclude with a 'no'. Any subsequent changes to the VP after the initial nomination will not affect the resolution of this market. The market can reach a resolution right after the nomination takes place.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average? (b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
question.body:
(a) This will resolve as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

(b) This will resolve as YES if Kamala Harris is nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this will resolve as NO. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed for any reason after the nomination. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 2 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average nor (b) Kamala Harris be the Democratic VP?
not_P.body:
(a) This will resolve as YES if Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election is not greater than 2 or not less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to the chart accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

(b) This will resolve as YES if Kamala Harris is not nominated as the Democratic VP. If someone else is selected as VP, this will resolve as YES. The resolution is based on the initial nomination and will not change if the VP is changed for any reason after the nomination. The market can resolve immediately after the nomination.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 2 but is 4 or lower on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average? (b) Kamala Harris serves as the Democratic Vice President?
para_P.body:
(a) This will be considered YES if Donald Trump is ahead of Joe Biden by more than 2 and at most 4 in 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election on July 15, 2024, according to the data reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

(b) This will be deemed YES if Kamala Harris is chosen as the Democratic Vice President. If a different individual is appointed as VP, this will be marked as NO. The outcome is determined by the initial selection and will remain unchanged even if the VP is altered for any reason after the nomination. The market can conclude right after the nomination.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

not_P.title: Will Joe Biden not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden does not appear in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If a qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden participate in a face-to-face interview on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
The latest relevant interview occurred when Biden was on The Howard Stern Show in April, where he engaged in a discussion for approximately 70 minutes. 

For this market to resolve to YES, Biden must take part in another face-to-face interview that lasts a minimum of 45 minutes. If no such qualifying interview is made available by the end of July, this market will resolve to NO. 

This market excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, town hall meetings, etc. It may include guest appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or segments edited into programs like 60 Minutes, provided there is at least 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed in person. A 50-minute video may only have 20 minutes of actual interview footage, which would not qualify. 

For reference, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his February appearance on Jimmy Fallon, and his previous features on 60 Minutes have each contained less than 30 minutes of interview footage with Biden.

question.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

not_P.title: Will Trump's lead over Biden be less than or equal to 3 or greater than 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as reported on the chart for the date of July 15, 2024, when accessed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

For the purposes of this question, a positive value means a Trump lead, while a negative value means Biden is leading. For example, as of July 5, 2024, the value reported for July 5 is Trump 2.4 points ahead of Biden, which would be a positive value of 2.4 for this purposes of this question.

para_P.title: On July 15, 2024, will Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden exceed 3 but not surpass 4, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be determined by the extent of Donald Trump's advantage over Joe Biden in 538's [national polling average for the 2024 presidential election](https://projects.fivethirtyeight.com/polls/president-general/2024/national/) as indicated on the chart for July 15, 2024, when reviewed by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

In this context, a positive figure signifies a lead for Trump, whereas a negative figure indicates Biden is in front. For instance, on July 5, 2024, the reported value shows Trump leading Biden by 2.4 points, which would be interpreted as a positive value of 2.4 for the purposes of this question.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, OR (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
question.body:
(a) Joe Biden will have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls. At least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person is required for it to count.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. This will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024, NOR (b) Trump's lead over Biden be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 on July 15, 2024, according to 538's national polling average?
not_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden will not have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes before the end of July 2024. This includes appearances on podcasts or late-night shows, or interviews edited into shows like 60 minutes, but excludes press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, and town halls. At least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person is required for it to count.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will not be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average for the 2024 presidential election. A positive value indicates a Trump lead, while a negative value indicates a Biden lead. This will be checked by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following takes place: (a) Joe Biden engages in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera lasting over 45 minutes before the conclusion of July 2024, OR (b) Donald Trump's advantage over Biden exceeds 3 but does not go beyond 4 on July 15, 2024, based on 538's national polling average?
para_P.body:
(a) Joe Biden will participate in a face-to-face interview or discussion on camera for more than 45 minutes before the end of July 2024. This encompasses appearances on podcasts or late-night talk shows, or segments edited into programs such as 60 Minutes, but does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraising events, or town hall meetings. A minimum of 45 minutes of new footage showing Biden being interviewed in person is necessary for it to be considered valid.

(b) On July 15, 2024, Donald Trump's lead over Joe Biden will be greater than 3 and less than or equal to 4 according to 538's national polling average for the upcoming presidential election in 2024. A positive figure signifies a Trump lead, whereas a negative figure indicates a Biden lead. This will be evaluated by Metaculus on July 17, 2024.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

not_P.title: Will Biden not remain President through end of July 2024?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if Biden does not remain US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he remains President through the end of July 2024. 

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

para_P.title: Will Biden still be in office as President by the conclusion of July 2024?
para_P.body:
This will be considered a YES if Biden is still serving as the US President by the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be deemed a NO if he steps down, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date.

A temporary delegation of authority under the 25th amendment (such as appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES outcome. (An Acting President is not the same as a President according to the Constitution)

question.title: Will Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will Ron DeSantis not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Ron DeSantis is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. At least one other candidate must be selected to resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution) (b) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. not_P.title: Will neither Biden remain President through end of July 2024 nor Ron DeSantis be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); it resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then. Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendment (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution) (b) Ron DeSantis is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as NO. This question is not restricted to candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future. For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Will Joe Biden continue to hold the office of President until the conclusion of July 2024, or will Ron DeSantis be chosen as the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if either of the following happens: (a) Biden stays in the role of US President until the end of July 2024 (ET); it will be a NO if he resigns, passes away, or otherwise stops being President prior to that date. A temporary handover of authority under the 25th amendment (i.e., appointing his Vice President as Acting President) does not result in a YES answer. (An Acting President is distinct from a President according to the Constitution.) (b) Ron DeSantis is named the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election by the Republican National Convention. All other contenders will be answered with NO. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; other possibilities may be introduced later. For this question, it does not matter who is awarded the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election. It is determined solely by the choice made by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: Will a swimmer win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
question.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events.

not_P.title: Will a swimmer not win the most gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
not_P.body: The question resolves as **Yes** if the athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a swimmer to secure the highest number of gold medals at the 2024 Paris Olympic Games?
para_P.body: The inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if the competitor who earns the greatest total of gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming events.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will fewer than 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: During the 2024 Olympic Games, will a minimum of 5 nations secure their first gold medal?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if 5 or more nations achieve their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will either of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals (b) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals competes in the swimming events. (b) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur at the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer wins the most gold medals (b) At least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
not_P.body: (a) The athlete with the highest number of 2024 Olympic gold medals does not compete in the swimming events. (b) Fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to credible sources.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following takes place during the 2024 Paris Olympics: (a) A swimmer secures the highest number of gold medals (b) At least five nations achieve their first Olympic gold medal?
para_P.body: (a) The competitor who earns the most gold medals at the 2024 Olympics participates in swimming. (b) Five or more nations earn their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Games, based on reliable reports.

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

not_P.title: Will fewer than 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
not_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if no public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

para_P.title: Will a minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public statement against the initiative to nominate Biden ahead of schedule?
para_P.body:
Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to voice their opposition to their party’s move to finalize President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than initially intended, which they believe suppresses the ongoing vigorous discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a legislator involved in the initiative.

A letter that has been drafted, shared by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, serves as the first public indication from Democrats since the recent assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain quite concerned about the prospects of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really poor decision by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a smart tactic to shut down debate and I suppose through sheer force, create unity, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman mentioned in an interview. He refrained from confirming the letter's existence.

This market will be resolved as YES if a public statement opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters with a total of 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market's closure, this market will resolve NO.
