question.title: Will either of the following occur: (1) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, or (2) Larry Elder is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
(1) At least 20 House or Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: 

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(2) Larry Elder is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election:

This question will resolve as **Yes** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (1) At least 20 House/Senate Democrats not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early, nor (2) Larry Elder not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
(1) At least 20 House or Senate Democrats do not sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early: 

Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if no public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of fewer than 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are met by market close, this market resolves NO.

(2) Larry Elder is not the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election:

This question will resolve as **No** if Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is not selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that one of the following will happen: (1) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate will endorse a public letter against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule, or (2) Larry Elder will be the chosen Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
(1) A minimum of 20 Democrats from the House or Senate endorse a public letter against the initiative to virtually nominate Biden ahead of schedule: 

Context from Politico:

Numerous House Democrats are coordinating a strategy to express their opposition to their party’s plan to expedite President Joe Biden’s nomination, which they believe suppresses the critical ongoing discussion regarding his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the initiative.

A letter drafted by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and acquired by POLITICO, provides the first public indication from Democrats since the recent attempted assassination of former President Donald Trump that many of their members remain profoundly concerned about Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Someone thinks it’s a clever way to stifle debate and I guess by sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t function that way,” Huffman stated in an interview. He refrained from confirming the existence of a letter.

This market will conclude with a YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination strategy is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators affiliated with the Democratic Party before the market closes at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple letters totaling 20 lawmakers' signatures would also suffice to resolve this market to YES. 

If these conditions are not fulfilled by the market close, this market will conclude with a NO.

(2) Larry Elder is the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election:

This question will be answered as **Yes** if Larry Elder is nominated by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently listed; additional options may be included later.

For this question, it does not matter who is nominated as the Republican candidate on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

question.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

not_P.title: At the 2024 Olympics, will fewer than 5 countries win their debut gold medal?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, according to [credible sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

para_P.title: Will five or more nations secure their first Olympic gold medal at the 2024 Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if five or more nations achieve their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris Olympics, based on [reliable sources](https://www.metaculus.com/help/faq/#definitions).

question.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win ≥15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Win <15 Gold Medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body:
This market will resolve to "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win less than 15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games. The source of resolution will be the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. Otherwise the market will resolve to "No".

In the event that Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won less than 15 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, the market will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will Individual Neutral Athletes Achieve at Least 15 Gold Medals at the 2024 Paris Olympics?
para_P.body:
This market will conclude with a "Yes" if Individual Neutral Athletes together secure 15 or more gold medals during the 2024 Olympic Games in Paris. The determination will be based on the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other reliable sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. If not, the market will conclude with a "No".

Should it be confirmed that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 15 or more gold medals before the Olympic Games finish, the market will immediately conclude with a "Yes".

question.title: Will either at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal or Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if either of the following conditions is met: (a) 5 or more countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, according to credible sources. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as verified by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won 15 or more gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this condition will resolve immediately to "Yes".

not_P.title: Will neither at least 5 countries win their debut gold medal nor Individual Neutral Athletes win ≥15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics?
not_P.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if neither of the following conditions is met: (a) fewer than 5 countries win their first-ever Olympic gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympics, according to credible sources. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes collectively win fewer than 15 gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, as verified by the official medal tally published by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other credible sources if such reporting from the IOC is unavailable. If Individual Neutral Athletes are confirmed to have won fewer than 15 gold medals prior to the end of the Games, this condition will resolve immediately to "Yes".

para_P.title: Will at least 5 nations secure their first gold medal or will Individual Neutral Athletes achieve 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if one of the following scenarios occurs: (a) 5 or more nations earn their inaugural Olympic gold medal at the Paris 2024 Olympic Games, based on reliable sources. (b) Individual Neutral Athletes together attain 15 or more gold medals at the Paris 2024 Olympics, as confirmed by the official medal count released by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or other trustworthy sources if the IOC's reporting is not available. If it is established that Individual Neutral Athletes have won 15 or more gold medals before the conclusion of the Games, this condition will be resolved immediately as "Yes".

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

This question will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue or accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

question.title: Will either Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election or Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if either of the following occurs: (a) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

For Liz Cheney, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For Joe Biden, to qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as No.

not_P.title: Will neither Liz Cheney be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election nor Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if neither of the following occurs: (a) Liz Cheney is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, nor (b) Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, stating that he will not seek and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

For Liz Cheney, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For Joe Biden, to qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this part of the question will resolve as Yes.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that either Liz Cheney will be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or that Joe Biden will declare by July 15, 2024, that he will not pursue the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if at least one of the following happens: (a) Liz Cheney is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, or (b) Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, indicating that he will not run for and will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Regarding Liz Cheney, it does not matter who is the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election; the decision is strictly based on who is nominated by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

For Joe Biden, in order for the answer to be Yes, the announcement must be clear and definitive: it must eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a conclusive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this portion of the question will be answered as No.

para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the coalition of the French Prime Minister is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, based on reliable sources.

question.title: Will the ID political group hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will the ID political group not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as **No** for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **No**.

This question resolves on the basis of [official statements by the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Will the ID political faction secure the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if the ID political faction secures the highest number of seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will conclude as **No** for all other political factions. In the event that two factions have an equal number of seats, both sub-questions will resolve as **Yes**.

This question resolves based on [official statements from the European Parliament](https://www.europarl.europa.eu/portal/en) or reliable media sources.

question.title: Will either of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
question.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is not New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if the ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as Yes.

This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur: (a) The Prime Minister of France belongs to a coalition other than New Popular Front or Together on July 30, 2024 (b) The ID political group holds the most seats after the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
not_P.body:
(a) This question will resolve as Yes if the party of the Prime Minister of France is New Popular Front or Together on July 30th, at 12:00 Central European Time, according to credible sources.

(b) This question will resolve as Yes if the ID political group does not hold the most seats after the 2024 European Parliament elections. It will resolve as No for all other political groups. If two groups are tied for seats, both sub-questions will resolve as No.

This question resolves on the basis of official statements by the European Parliament or credible media reports.

para_P.title: Is it possible that one of the following happens: (a) The Prime Minister of France is part of a coalition that is neither New Popular Front nor Together on July 30, 2024 (b) The ID political faction secures the highest number of seats following the 2024 European Parliamentary Elections?
para_P.body:
(a) This inquiry will be answered with Yes if, as of July 30th at 12:00 Central European Time, the Prime Minister of France's party is not aligned with New Popular Front or Together, based on reliable sources.

(b) This inquiry will be answered with Yes if the ID political faction has the most seats after the European Parliament elections in 2024. It will be answered with No for any other political factions. In the event of a tie between two factions for seats, both sub-questions will be answered with Yes.

The resolution of this question relies on official announcements from the European Parliament or trustworthy media coverage.

question.title: Will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
This market resolves YES if "Trap" (2024) receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and it resolves NO if it receives a B- or lower. If for some reason a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context: 

"Trap" is the next film directed by the legendary M. Night Shyamalan (with a great trailer).

question.title: Will either "House of the Dragon" S2E8 be rated >8.5 on IMDB 2 days after release, or will M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receive a CinemaScore of B or above?
question.body:
This question resolves to YES if either of the following occurs: 

(a) "House of the Dragon" S2E8 (season finale) receives an IMDB rating greater than 8.5 two days after its release. The resolution is based on the score displayed on IMDB two days after the episode's release (August 6th), at noon PT. The rating must be a strict inequality (>8.5) using the precision listed by IMDB (typically a single decimal).

(b) M. Night Shyamalan's "Trap" (2024) receives a CinemaScore of B or higher. This resolves YES if the film receives a B CinemaScore or higher, and NO if it receives a B- or lower. If a CinemaScore is not reported, this resolves N/A.

Context:

For "House of the Dragon":
- Season 1 IMDB ratings ranged from 8.0 to 9.3.
- Season 2 ratings so far range from 6.1 to 9.6.

For "Trap":
- Recent M. Night Shyamalan films have received CinemaScores ranging from C to B+.
